Subject: FW: Upcoming assignments fort Bill Farnbach
Body:
FYI

 

 

From: Benipal, Amarjeet S@DOT 
Sent: Wednesday, August 27, 2014 9:22 AM
To: Farnbach, William K@DOT
Cc: Takigawa, Steve K@DOT; Tavares, Tony F@DOT; Price, Steve N@DOT; Vacura, Peter J@DOT; Stolarski, Phil J@DOT; Stayton, John C@DOT; Balasubramanian, Srikanth N@DOT; Burmas, Nick I@DOT; Massey, Susan C@DOT; Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Subject: Upcoming assignments fort Bill Farnbach

 

Hi Bill,

 

Thank you for stopping by today on your day off to meet with me.  Based on our discussion, here are the key activities you will be engaged upon your return from your vacation on September 8, 2014.  Please report to GWO's office and will assign Charles Dayton's cubicle.  Nick Burmas will continue his assignment with Office of Concrete & Foundations till December 2, 2014.  At that point, you will return to Office of Concrete & Foundations.

 

List of assignments

1.  PaveM Engineering Configuration

 

2.  PaveM Performance Models

 

3.  APCS Manual

 

4.  Review & feedback of APCS contract

 

5.  Evaluation of LCCA program to allow for Alternative Bidding procurement methods

 

6.  Longer Life AC Design recommendation Tables in HDM

 

7.  May utilize assistance in D3's 10 Yr Plan (once I had opportunity to meet with District Management

 

If you have any questions or comments, please reply or call.  Thank you.

Subject: Do not Forget your Dr. Pepper for Charles Dayton!
Body:
Hello Everyone, 

Reminder that this Thursday is the Luncheon for Charles M Dayton!  

As a fun thing to do, since Charles loves Dr. Pepper so much, please bring a small Dr. Pepper for Charles as a Gift.

 



What! I’m retiring?? But, I have not even packed!!!

 

On the managing the event side, at the door, we will give everyone a table tent indicating your menu selection and collecting the money for those that have not paid.  If you want soda, coffee or tea, there will be a $2 charge.  Refills are included.

 

If you have any questions please feel free to contact me.

Thank you, 

 

Hector Vergara

Division of Maintenance

Pavement Program

Office of Pavement Management & Performance, MS-91

2389 Gateway Oaks Dr., Suite 200

Sacramento, CA 95833

Office: (916) 274-6080

Office of Pavement Management <http://www.dot.ca.gov/hq/maint/Pavement/Pavement_Program/index.html>

Also, the JASPER_REPORT role has the CREATE SYNONYM privilege, so you can create synonyms for each table or view that you have select privileges on.

 

For example,

 

CREATE SYNONYM "PMS_ANALYSIS_SCENARIO_WP " FOR "PMS_CA"."PMS_ANALYSIS_SCENARIO_WP”;

        I can find column names and data types of each field for some tables there, but that is not what I want. 

 

        I don’t know which database is good for testing. If they have the same structure that will work. 

        Which version of Oracle Database are you using,  11g or older? 

        Currently, I need access to the following tables/views for the design. 

        (ca_ea_benefit_vw, pms_analysis_scenario_wp, pms_analysis_scenario, pms_analysis_scenario, setup_loc_ident, setup_ca_county, setup_column_id)

        I need to take a look at the relations, field names, field types, etc. I also need real access to the tables/views to test the Sql queries.  

 

        I have attached a screen shot of how to deploy the templates for auto report generation also. (See InsertJasperReport.png and ShowReport.png )

        Basically, we just need to insert Jasper Report and then right click to show report in PaveM.

Thanks, 

 

Jing Hua Zhao

Subject: RE: Sample/Test Database
Body:
Jing,

 

Your password has been reset to: jzhao234

 

Also,  I was able to get the “Reset Password” menu option to work in SQL Developer 4.0.1 and 4.0.2.  You need to install the Oracle Instant Client version 12.1.  Then under the “Tools” menu in SQL Developer, select Preferences.

 



 

Then under Database, select Advanced.

 



 

Click on the “Use Oracle Client” check box.  Click the “Configure” button.

 



 

For Client_Type select Instant Client.  Then browse to the instant client directory.  Then click the Test button and check for success.

 

Testing the Instant Client located at D:\Oracle_software\Windows Client\SQL Developer\instantclient-basiclite-windows.x64-12.1.0.1.0\instantclient_12_1

Testing client directory ... OK

Testing loading Oracle JDBC driver ... OK

Testing checking Oracle JDBC driver version ... OK

  Driver version: 12.1.0.1.0

Testing testing native OCI library load ... OK

Success! 

Regards,

 

Kevin

From: Eric Perrone [mailto:eric@agileassets.com] 
Sent: Friday, August 22, 2014 10:49 AM
To: Wang, Zhongren@DOT
Subject: RE: Test Request: Change of parameters of groovy script

 

Ok so it looks basically good but the query is this now:

 

       and a.eff_year >= $P{EFF_YEAR}

       and TO_NUMBER (SUBSTR (a.ca_ea_no, 1, 2)) = $P{CA_DISTRICT_ID}

 

Which is year > = the user entered year and the district equal to the user entered district.

 

If you want the ability to leave the parameter blank you should modify the query to this:

 

       and (a.eff_year >= $P{EFF_YEAR} or $P{EFF_YEAR} is null)

       and (TO_NUMBER (SUBSTR (a.ca_ea_no, 1, 2)) = $P{CA_DISTRICT_ID} or $P{CA_DISTRICT_ID}  is null)

Jing,

 

It appears that to reset an expired password in SQL Developer, you need to do the following.

 

SQL Developer has a built-in reset password option that may work for your situation. It requires adding Oracle Instant Client to the workstation as well. When instant client is in the path when SQL developer launches you will get the following option enabled:



Oracle Instant Client does not need admin privileges to install, just the ability to write to a directory and add that directory to the users path. Most users have the privileges to do this.

Recap: In order to use Reset Password on Oracle SQL Developer:

1.	You must unpack the Oracle Instant Client in a directory
2.	You must add the Oracle Instant Client directory to the users path
3.	You must then restart Oracle SQL Developer

At this point you can right click a data source and reset your password.

See http://www.thatjeffsmith.com/archive/2012/11/resetting-your-oracle-user-password-with-sql-developer/ for a complete walk-through 

Also see the comment in the oracle docs: http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E35137_01/appdev.32/e35117/dialogs.htm#RPTUG41808

 

Regards,

 

Kevin

Kevin, 

 

        Jasper Reports is similar to Access and Crystal Report. We can design report templates and generate reports with external data source. (Access has internal data source.)

 

        I have attached a screen shot of Jasper Reports. (See attachment WhatisJasperReport.png)

        You can see a long Sql query in the middle. After typing the query the field names would show right below it. 

        We need those field names when designing report templates. 

        We can preview the query result at the bottom also. (See PreviewData.png)

 

        I have access to the following link now.  https://hosting.agileassets.com/pms_ca/Kernel/w_login.jsp. 

        I can find column names and data types of each field for some tables there, but that is not what I want. 

 

        I don’t know which database is good for testing. If they have the same structure that will work. 

        Which version of Oracle Database are you using,  11g or older? 

        Currently, I need access to the following tables/views for the design. 

        (ca_ea_benefit_vw, pms_analysis_scenario_wp, pms_analysis_scenario, pms_analysis_scenario, setup_loc_ident, setup_ca_county, setup_column_id)

        I need to take a look at the relations, field names, field types, etc. I also need real access to the tables/views to test the Sql queries.  

 

        I have attached a screen shot of how to deploy the templates for auto report generation also. (See InsertJasperReport.png and ShowReport.png )

        Basically, we just need to insert Jasper Report and then right click to show report in PaveM. 

        I have also attached a page of a deliverable report for reference. (See forReference.pdf)

 

Thanks, 

 

Jing Hua Zhao

Eric, 
 
Let me know whether you can do a GTM with us on your first day back. This is the things we would like to discuss and resolve. 
 

1.	Step through the benefit calculation process.

4.	Add ‘stretching’ algothms to stretch the boundaries of the programmed projects based on the finest partition. 
5.	Include support costs for MWP?

 
Zhongren

From: Zhao, Jing@DOT 
Sent: Wednesday, August 20, 2014 2:10 PM
To: Walsh, Kevin M@DOT
Cc: Wang, Zhongren@DOT; Wong, Gerry C@DOT
Subject: RE: Sample/Test Database

 

Kevin, 

 

        Jasper Reports is similar to Access and Crystal Report. We can design report templates and generate reports with external data source. (Access has internal data source.)

 

        I have attached a screen shot of Jasper Reports. (See attachment WhatisJasperReport.png)

        You can see a long Sql query in the middle. After typing the query the field names would show right below it. 

        We need those field names when designing report templates. 

        We can preview the query result at the bottom also. (See PreviewData.png)

 

        I have access to the following link now.  https://hosting.agileassets.com/pms_ca/Kernel/w_login.jsp. 

        I can find column names and data types of each field for some tables there, but that is not what I want. 

 

        I don’t know which database is good for testing. If they have the same structure that will work. 

        Which version of Oracle Database are you using,  11g or older? 

        Currently, I need access to the following tables/views for the design. 

        (ca_ea_benefit_vw, pms_analysis_scenario_wp, pms_analysis_scenario, pms_analysis_scenario, setup_loc_ident, setup_ca_county, setup_column_id)

        I need to take a look at the relations, field names, field types, etc. I also need real access to the tables/views to test the Sql queries.  

 

        I have attached a screen shot of how to deploy the templates for auto report generation also. (See InsertJasperReport.png and ShowReport.png )

        Basically, we just need to insert Jasper Report and then right click to show report in PaveM. 

        I have also attached a page of a deliverable report for reference. (See forReference.pdf)

 

Thanks, 

 

Jing Hua Zhao

Subject: Preservation Index Calculation
Body:
Jeremy and Eric, 

Could you pls help confirm whether this is the way the preservation benefit index is determined in PaveM? Jing and I read into the codes, and this is the best I can grasp. Pls let us know. 

Also, please let us know how project lane miles and costs played into this index, is it just the area between the curve, or have considered the length and costs of the project. 

Another topic we will focus is WHY the index has such a wide range. See the attached spreadsheet. On the other hand, why some of the project share the same index value (too much cluttered). 

Zhongren

Subject: RE: Negative Benefit - SJ-012
Body:
Thank you Jeremy for the investigation. In Scenario #1366, there are a total of 18 programmed projects (L/R separated as shown) showed negative preservation benefit values. Could you please help delve into those, to confirm whether they are caused by similar reasons? If it is, it just proved that there should not be negative values, and every time when we see a negative value, we should work to fix the overlapping postmiles and re-run PaveM. We also talked with Eric to develop an algorithm to stretch the boundaries of the programmed projects according to the finest partitions (I know you have done it one time outside of PaveM). 

 

Gerry and I did some tests also. We found for the same SJ 12 project, if the medium overlay is applied 5 years into the future (year 2020), then the benefit also becomes positive. See Scenario #1368-1370. 

 

More importantly, I want to step through the benefit calculation process. This is an essential step for us to develop more confidence of the ranking index. I will set up a GTM with Eric this Thursday. 

 

Zhongren

 

 



 

 

 

From: jeremylea@gmail.com [mailto:jeremylea@gmail.com] On Behalf Of Jeremy Lea
Sent: Tuesday, August 19, 2014 1:46 PM
To: Wong, Gerry C@DOT
Cc: Eric Perrone; Pyle, Thomas A@DOT; Holland, Joe@DOT; John Harvey; Zhao, Jing@DOT; Wang, Zhongren@DOT; Vergara, Hector@DOT; Jones, Ron D@DOT; Weber, Brian A@DOT; Massey, Susan C@DOT
Subject: Re: Negative Benefit - SJ-012

 

Hi all,

OK, so the network master was out of date, but it is the EA 10-0G800 that is causing trouble.  In Hector's files this project runs from PM 0.1 to 5.1.  This gets fixed up by my code to 0.000 to M5.087.  There is a bridge end at M5.002.  The 8a segmentation has a boundary at M5.01 (I'd have to talk to Jon to find the origin of that).  The Coarse segmentation has a boundary at M5.000 since there is a master work plan project at that point, which forces a break.

Because of the 0.087 mile overlap the coarse segmentation picks up 10-0G800 has the last maintenance for the M5.000 to 11.000 segment and because of the aging of the condition (and the fact that the completion date of the project is 12/24/2012 and the data collection date was 8/02/2012), the condition of the segment gets improved.  As a result it looks like it does not need maintenance and so the benefit of doing a project in 2015 is negative (the 2012 project is a thick overlay and the 2015 is a medium overlay).

Some things that can be done to fix this:


1. At the moment the as-built fix up code assumes that post miles are rounded to 0.1 miles, so it looks for bridges in +-0.05 miles, and snaps to them.  It then looks for other events.  In this case it finds an event at M5.087 and assumes that this was the postmile that was rounded to get 5.1 on the plans.  I could increase the range to +-0.1 miles and that would snap the 5.1 to M5.002 (the end of the bridge), which would then get moved to the start of the bridge and no longer overlap the coarse segment.

2. We could adjust the Updated Target Table queries in the Network Master to require at least 0.1 miles of overlap between a project and a segment before it was counted as a true reflection of past construction history.  Or even require that the as-built cover at least half the segment (overlaps the center).

3. We could do both.


Looking at Google Earth, the construction actually ran for about 1.2 miles after the end of the bridge (so about PM 6.5) so none of these solutions is correct.  Nor is the PM 5.0 start of the 2015 project.

None of these will remove negative benefits.  But as can be seen here, if we suppressed or removed the negative benefits we would not be alerted to the inconsistencies on the data.

Regards,

  -Jeremy

From: jeremylea@gmail.com <mailto:jeremylea@gmail.com>  [mailto:jeremylea@gmail.com <mailto:jeremylea@gmail.com> ] On Behalf Of Jeremy Lea
Sent: Tuesday, August 19, 2014 10:49 AM
To: Wang, Zhongren@DOT
Cc: Eric Perrone; Wong, Gerry C@DOT; Pyle, Thomas A@DOT; Holland, Joe@DOT; John Harvey; Zhao, Jing@DOT
Subject: Re: Negative Benefit

 

Hi,

The reason for the negative benefit appears to be that this section on SJ-012 last had an overlay in 2012 and now one is programmed for 2015.  However, I can't find the 2012 project in the as-built history where it should be, which makes me think the network master is out of date (both fine and coarse segmentation).  Can I reload/reage the Network Master for this route?

Regards,

  -Jeremy

 

On Mon, Aug 18, 2014 at 10:14 AM, Wang, Zhongren@DOT <zhongren.wang@dot.ca.gov <mailto:zhongren.wang@dot.ca.gov> > wrote:

Jeremy and Eric, I hope to have a GTM on this tomorrow when you come back from your vacation (sorry!). We have done some investigations, and found the following:

 

(1)    Negative values occur only for the programmed projects, not the system generated ones (as long as preservation index is concerned.)

(2)    For the SJ 12 PM 5-11 case, if the timing is scheduled as 2020, instead of the current 2015, the negative value for the medium overlay will become positive. See Scenario #1368 and #1369. 

(3)    Still, we felt it is illogical: even if we keep on overlaying a good pavement, the preservation benefit should not go negative. That is why we want to step through the computer codes, and find out why negative benefit occur. 

(4)    Jing and I read the groovy a bit, and Jing pointed out that no negative value should be produced, because the code takes cares of negative values already:

detValues[accumYears] = [benThreshold[piArrayIndex]-pi[piArrayIndex].ConvertFrom100(detValues[accumYears]),0].max();

(5)    This morning, when I examined the detailed optimization results, and found something interesting. In the analysis set up, all exclusion years are zeroed out to “0”, but for this project, the exclusion year is shown as “1”. I am not sure that is the reason for the negative benefit? See Scenario #1367, and the enclosed detailed analysis results. 

 

Zhongren

916-274-6177

Subject: Re: Negative Benefit
Body:
Hi,


The reason for the negative benefit appears to be that this section on SJ-012 last had an overlay in 2012 and now one is programmed for 2015.  However, I can't find the 2012 project in the as-built history (contract ID 225905), where it should be, which makes me think the network master is out of date (both fine and coarse segmentation).  Can I reload/reage the Network Master for this route?


Regards,

  -Jeremy




On Mon, Aug 18, 2014 at 10:14 AM, Wang, Zhongren@DOT <zhongren.wang@dot.ca.gov <mailto:zhongren.wang@dot.ca.gov> > wrote:


	Jeremy and Eric, I hope to have a GTM on this tomorrow when you come back from your vacation (sorry!). We have done some investigations, and found the following:

	 

	(1)    Negative values occur only for the programmed projects, not the system generated ones (as long as preservation index is concerned.)

	(2)    For the SJ 12 PM 5-11 case, if the timing is scheduled as 2020, instead of the current 2015, the negative value for the medium overlay will become positive. See Scenario #1368 and #1369. 

	(3)    Still, we felt it is illogical: even if we keep on overlaying a good pavement, the preservation benefit should not go negative. That is why we want to step through the computer codes, and find out why negative benefit occur. 

	(4)    Jing and I read the groovy a bit, and Jing pointed out that no negative value should be produced, because the code takes cares of negative values already:

	detValues[accumYears] = [benThreshold[piArrayIndex]-pi[piArrayIndex].ConvertFrom100(detValues[accumYears]),0].max();

	(5)    This morning, when I examined the detailed optimization results, and found something interesting. In the analysis set up, all exclusion years are zeroed out to “0”, but for this project, the exclusion year is shown as “1”. I am not sure that is the reason for the negative benefit? See Scenario #1367, and the enclosed detailed analysis results. 

	 

	Zhongren

	916-274-6177

	 

	




-- 
Jeremy Lea     Project Engineer | Tel:  +1 530 752 4916
  UC Pavement Research Center   | Cell: +1 530 219 8390
University of California, Davis | http://www.ucprc.ucdavis.edu/

Gerry, 

 

       I have figured out a way to hide the current year and past year automatically.

       For example, if you run the report on 1/1/2015 (Still Fiscal Year 2014/2015, i.e., 7/1/14 - 6/30/15), the report won’t show the records in 2014 2013 and 2015 2014. 

If you run the report on 7/1/2015 (Fiscal Year 2015/2016), the report won’t show the records in 2013, 2014 & 2015.  

       Another example, if you run it on 12/31/2014, the report won’t show the records in 2013 and 2014. (This one is correct.)

       Not sure whether this is the way you want because you are using different year system (July 1 is the beginning of the year). 

       Please tell me how do you exactly want to hide it.  

 

Thanks, 

 

Jing Hua Zhao

Subject: Negative Benefit
Body:
Jeremy and Eric, I hope to have a GTM on this tomorrow when you come back from your vacation (sorry!). We have done some investigations, and found the following:

 

(1)    Negative values occur only for the programmed projects, not the system generated ones (as long as preservation index is concerned.)

(2)    For the SJ 12 PM 5-11 case, if the timing is scheduled as 2020, instead of the current 2015, the negative value for the medium overlay will become positive. See Scenario #1368 and #1369. 

(3)    Still, we felt it is illogical: even if we keep on overlaying a good pavement, the preservation benefit should not go negative. That is why we want to step through the computer codes, and find out why negative benefit occur. 

(4)    Jing and I read the groovy a bit, and Jing pointed out that no negative value should be produced, because the code takes cares of negative values already:

detValues[accumYears] = [benThreshold[piArrayIndex]-pi[piArrayIndex].ConvertFrom100(detValues[accumYears]),0].max();

(5)    This morning, when I examined the detailed optimization results, and found something interesting. In the analysis set up, all exclusion years are zeroed out to “0”, but for this project, the exclusion year is shown as “1”. I am not sure that is the reason for the negative benefit? See Scenario #1367, and the enclosed detailed analysis results. 

 

Zhongren

916-274-6177

Eric, Still the same topic. I found PaveM acts on its own by changing the sequence of the decision trees. For example, the Coarse Tree for Calibration I just created, Node #1 and #4 are switched by the system. There should be a bug something out there. Please help check it out. Just confirmed again because no matter how I change the thresholds of the tree, the system is not performing the way it is supposed to be.  

 

Gerry, the current Tree for Coarse Segmentation is also WRONG! Node #2 and #4 was swapped. Node #2, in the current status is pointing to CAPM or Rehab type of treatment; which should be the content of Node #4. 

 

Zhongren

Subject: Possible way to resolve the first Jasper report.
Body:
1. Using subreport to list the details of each EA group. 


2. <dataSourceExpression><![CDATA[$P{REPORT_DATA_SOURCE}.cloneDataSource()]]></dataSourceExpression>


3.http://www.tutorialspoint.com/jasper_reports/jasper_quick_guide.htm


4. Don't do <dataSourceExpression><![CDATA[$P{REPORT_DATA_SOURCE}]]></dataSourceExpression>


5. Maybe you should use <connectionExpression><![CDATA[$P{REPORT_CONNECTION}]]></connectionExpression>
    instead <dataSourceExpression><![CDATA[$P{REPORT_DATA_SOURCE}]]></dataSourceExpression>


6. You can pass datasource via the built-in REPORT_DATA_SOURCE parameter.

The example:

<subreport>
    <reportElement x="261" y="25" width="200" height="100"/>
    <dataSourceExpression><![CDATA[$P{REPORT_DATA_SOURCE}]]></dataSourceExpression>
    <subreportExpression><![CDATA[$P{SUBREPORT_DIR} + "subreport.jasper"]]></subreportExpression>
</subreport>


7. You can create new instance of datasource based on variable, parameter or field.

The sample:

<variable name="HeadingsCollection" class="java.util.Collection" calculation="System">
    <initialValueExpression><![CDATA[new java.util.ArrayList()]]></initialValueExpression>
</variable>
...
<subreport>
    <reportElement x="0" y="0" width="515" height="20"/>
    <subreportParameter name="ReportTitle">
        <subreportParameterExpression><![CDATA[$P{ReportTitle}]]></subreportParameterExpression>
    </subreportParameter>
    <dataSourceExpression><![CDATA[new net.sf.jasperreports.engine.data.JRBeanCollectionDataSource($V{HeadingsCollection})]]></dataSourceExpression>
    <subreportExpression class="java.lang.String"><![CDATA["HeadingsReport.jasper"]]></subreportExpression>
</subreport>


8. Another sample:
<field name="cast" class="java.util.Collection"/>
...
<subreport>
    <reportElement positionType="Float" x="15" y="25" width="245" height="20" isRemoveLineWhenBlank="true" backcolor="#99CCFF"/>
    <dataSourceExpression><![CDATA[new JRBeanCollectionDataSource($F{cast})]]></dataSourceExpression>
    <subreportExpression class="java.lang.String"><![CDATA["JRMDbCastSubreport.jasper"]]></subreportExpression>
</subreport>


9. Or you can pass the datasource via the parameter:
<parameter name="SubreportDataSource" class="net.sf.jasperreports.engine.JRDataSource"/>
...
<subreport>
    <reportElement positionType="Float" x="15" y="25" width="245" height="20" isRemoveLineWhenBlank="true"/>
    <dataSourceExpression>$P{SubreportDataSource}</dataSourceExpression>
    <subreportExpression class="java.lang.String"><![CDATA["Subreport.jasper"]]></subreportExpression>
</subreport>

Subject: ** IMPORTANT ** Password Expiration Notification
Body:
*** YOUR PASSWORD IS EXPIRED ***


Please Change your Login ID Password at your Earliest Opportunity to
Prevent Service Disruption.
_________________________________ 

What is my Login ID?  Your Login ID is what you use to log into your workstation and CTPass (example: s123456). 


LAPTOP USERS:  From CTPass follow the instructions below to change your password:


1.	Log into CTPass. 
2.	Under Password Management, click on the Change Password link. 
3.	Enter your old (current) password in the Old password dialog box. 
4.	Enter and confirm your new password in the New password and the Retype password dialog boxes. 
5.	Click the Submit button. Your password should now be changed.
	

DESKTOP USERS:  From your workstation follow the instructions below to change your password:


1.	From your workstation connected to the Caltrans Network, press CTRL + ALT + Delete, click Change a password. 
2.	Click on the CT logo identified with your Login ID (example: s123456). 
3.	From the Change your Novell Password dialog box, enter your current password in the Old Password field. 
4.	Enter your new password in the New Password field, then re-enter the new password in the Confirm new password field. Press Enter. 
5.	From the Change Password dialog box, ensure that CT and Caltrans resources are selected. If they are not, left click to select. Click OK. 
6.	You will receive a message indicating that your password has been changed. Click OK to close the message.
	

PLEASE NOTE: If you need assistance changing your password via a remote connection, please contact the Service Desk at Caltrans.IT.Servicedesk@dot.ca.gov <mailto:Caltrans.IT.Servicedesk@dot.ca.gov>  or (916) 654-4216.

Subject: RE: Message from Jing.
Body:
Hi Jing

 

For highways, GHG is generated in two ways.

 

1.       By the vehicles that run over the pavement.    There is early proof that concrete highways cause vehicles to use about 2-3% less fuel than asphalt highways.   It is not entirely known why, but early assumptions are either that the surface is a bit “stickier” or else that AC  deflects a bit.  It may also have to do with roughness, but empirical testing is not proving that.  Nevertheless, if we could improve the smoothness of highways and/or make them concrete, and have 300,000 vehicles use 2% less fuel, then the savings by ADT would be significant.

2.       The other cause of GHG is the mere construction of the highway.    The mining of the aggregate, trucking it to the site, and all the construction activities account for quite a bit of GHG.   Also, the materials manufacturing causes significant GHG release.   Asphalt must be heated to 350 degrees, and the energy to do that results in a great deal of co2 release.  Thus warm asphalt is of great interest because it only has to be heated to 250 degrees.   As for concrete manufacturing, the cement is very GHG intensive.  In fact cement is perhaps the most GHG producing product that mankind makes.   In China alone, which just passed the USA in terms of total GHG release, cement accounts for 30% of their total GHG output.  Also, every ton of cement produced releases about 1 ton of CO2.  (There is a side point here that if we can make our highways last longer, before first rehabilitation, than we would be making great savings.  )  

 

Both of these reasons are in some ways related to ADT.    Number one is obvious, but for number 2, we consider that if a highway is in construction for 1-3 years, there is a certain amount of construction induced traffic delay which results in cars moving slower and thus GHG generation.   More cars sitting in traffic control  means more GHG being produced.   The models we hope to produce will account for all of these factors.   There are studies being conducted all over the world, by universities, private companies, and transportation agencies to consider these aspects of GHG generation on highways.  While most of the world thinks about GHG generation from the bottom of the tire up, we need to think of ways to save GHG from the bottom of the tire down.     

 

I am sure there are other points some may want to point out.  

 

From: Zhao, Jing@DOT 
Sent: Wednesday, August 27, 2014 9:04 AM
To: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Subject: Message from Jing. 

 

I get the correlation between ADT and GHG now. They are kind of inverse related to each other. GHG should be small when ADT/ADTT is big, correct?    Jing

Subject: RE: Benefit numbers
Body:
That looks pretty good especially with Report 3 for the “Scenario Recommended” projects, when there is no negative values.

 



 

However, if you run Reports 1 & 2 with Statewide Programmed Projects (SAP), then we will have some negative values.  Are we going to normalize the smallest negative number to 1?  Or else, we will have negative indices.  I do believe that we need to utilize the minimum value as well in the normalization process.  Please take a look at this.

 

Another minor comment will be, we won’t need to have accuracy down to the 9th decimal places for the normalized number (as shown in your spreadsheet) especially after we normalize it to 40.

 

Gerry Wong

Senior Pavement Engineer

Office of Planning & Programming

Division of Maintenance - Pavement Management

(916) 274-6062

Subject: FW: Macro for filling missing numbers in a sequence.
Body:
________________________________

From: zhaojinghua@hotmail.com
To: zhaojinghua@hotmail.com
Subject: Macro for filling missing numbers in a sequence.
Date: Tue, 2 Sep 2014 22:06:10 -0700


Sub FillMissingNumbers()
    Dim rRange As Range, lRow As Long
    Dim lRows As Long
     
    Range("A:A").EntireColumn.Insert
    Cells(1, 1) = "difference"
     
    Set rRange = Range("B2", Cells(Rows.Count, "B").End(xlUp).Offset(-1, 0)).Offset(0, -1)
     
    With rRange
        .FormulaR1C1 = "=IF(R[1]C[1]-RC[1]=1,"""",R[1]C[1]-RC[1])"
        .Copy
        .PasteSpecial xlValues
        Application.CutCopyMode = False
        Set rRange = .Columns(1).SpecialCells(xlCellTypeConstants)
    End With
     
    On Error Resume Next
    For lRow = Cells(Rows.Count, "A").End(xlUp).Row To 2 Step -1
        If IsNumeric(Cells(lRow, "A")) Then
            lRows = Cells(lRow, "A")
            Cells(lRow, "A")(2, 1).Range("A1:A" & lRows - 1).EntireRow.Insert
        End If
    Next lRow
     
    With Range("A2")
        .Value = Range("B2")
        .AutoFill .Range("A1:A" & Cells(Rows.Count, "B").End(xlUp).Row), Type:=xlLinearTrend
        .Range("A2:A" & Cells(Rows.Count, "B").End(xlUp).Row).Cut Range("B2")
        .EntireColumn.Delete
    End With
     
End Sub

CC: (Address): /O=MMS/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=Zhao, Jing@DOc3dc9efb-e895-4718-ab58-360e65c1f3a42a8

Subject: RE: Important message from Jing.
Body:
Hi Jing

 

Speaking for myself and others in the office, we are very grateful to have you working here.  You have very valuable and unique talents and have been very helpful, and the search that Peter did to find you proved valuable.    You are very smart and a hard worker.  

 

At this link are the minimum requirements for the classification that Hector works in.   Unfortunately I do not have any openings in that position.   It is possible that you meet those minimum requirements, but I am not sure.  You would have to take the test (on-line) and then get on the list to be considered for an interview if there is an opening soon.   I have an opening for a Senior Transportation Engineer, (the one that Charles just left) but you are not eligible for that position.   

 

http://www.dot.ca.gov/hq/jobs/Duty_Statements/transportation_engineer_civil.pdf 

 

I recommend that you also explore the following link to see if there are positions that you would be eligible for.  

 

http://jobs.spb.ca.gov/wvpos/search_p.cfm?dept=transportation

 

The reason I asked what area you are currently educated in, and asked what your degree was in, is because if you can tell Zhongren, Gerry and me what type of career(s) you would really like to have, then we can help you to find if there are jobs at Caltrans for you.  This is important to know because you must meet what are called Minimum Requirements in order to be able to “test” for a job, and then get on a list to be able to interview.  It is not so easy to navigate your way through the job process in state government, and the rules don’t always make sense, so we’d happy to help.   If you need a reference, I will be happy to tell you that working here, and doing a good job.   Being able to use us a reference will be very valuable, even if you cannot get the pay you so desire.  

 

I have one more recommendation…  It is the same advice that my father gave me when I started college to be a civil engineer…  My dad told me that any engineer could do the engineering part, to stand apart I needed to be able to speak and write well.  He recommended that I take as many writing and speaking courses as I could.   Which I did.   They were very difficult courses for me, but they got easier as I went.   Now I am very comfortable to write and speak, but it took a great deal of effort.  As you prepare for interviews, jobs, and  a career, it is very important to be able to teach those who not scientifically minded (as well as those who are) what you did, and can do, regarding your work.  

 

Please let me know if you have any other questions.  

 

-Tom

Subject: FW: Introducing a New Statewide Pavement Core Database
Body:
FYI

 

From: Dirrim, Peter W@DOT 
Sent: Wednesday, September 03, 2014 2:07 PM
To: Thorpe, George L@DOT; Mccormick, Terry R@DOT; Housley, Toby B@DOT; Gamboa, Ed O@DOT; Johnson, Glenn A@DOT; Ash, Bryan S@DOT; Barrett, John D@DOT; Jones, David P@DOT; Karlson, Eric@DOT; Evans, David S@DOT
Cc: Ferchaud, Dan R@DOT; Mishra, Tinu@DOT; Chan, Richard@DOT; Mooradian, Ted B@DOT; Stahl, Kirsten R@DOT; Fitzgerald, Tom J@DOT; Berger, Byron J@DOT; Lambert, Bruce W@DOT; Dhillon, Devinder S@DOT; Kean, Bruce W@DOT; Padilla, Art F@DOT; Baseghi, Behdad@DOT
Subject: Introducing a New Statewide Pavement Core Database

 

Pavement Coring Personnel,

 

Caltrans needs to make pavement core data available to all the functional units in the department.  To accomplish this goal a web-based application was developed by the Pavement Program to track and store core data generated by our projects.  The core information is entered via an application developed by UCPRC at UC Davis called iGPR-Core.  This simple application presents all the available core data locations on a Google map where each location can be selected showing detailed core information, as shown below. Currently,  iGPR-Core contains data for over 3,000 cores statewide and new ones get added all the time.  

 



 

Before this application can be used, the user must register to verify their identity.  This requires you to go to the first link below and click on the “Register” button, as shown in the “Login to Site” section above.  A screen will appear where you enter your name, district, a password, a security question and response, then click on the “Create User” button.  After you have registered, you will have to wait for the system administrator to verify the information you have provided.  Two Emails notes will be sent to you, after that you will be able to login with your user name and password.    

 

The link to gain access to the iGPR-Core application is:

 

 http://www.ucprc.ucdavis.edu/igpr-core/ <http://www.ucprc.ucdavis.edu/igpr-core/>  

 

The training materials for this application can be found at:

 

http://onramp.dot.ca.gov/hq/maint/pavement/GPR.shtml <http://onramp.dot.ca.gov/hq/maint/pavement/GPR.shtml> 

 

Please take some time and try this new application, then let me know if it suits your needs and how we could improve it.  In the future, we would like to have the contractor enter data core results directly into this system.

 

 

Peter Dirrim

2386 Gateway Oaks Drive, Suite 200

Sacramento, CA 95833

Subject: Space Available - STANDARD FIRST AID - September 15th and 16th

 

We Have  S p a c e  Available!

STANDARD FIRST AID

This course includes Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) and Automated External Defibrillator (AED) hands-on training, and satisfies the California Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) requirements, as well as other Federal and State regulatory requirements for training employees to respond appropriately to medical emergencies on the job.

 

Please Forward to Your Respective Areas

The target audience includes all Tree Maintenance, Electrical, Construction, Field Workers, Foundation Drillers, Safety Officers, Traveling and P.M. Mechanics, First-Aid Response Team Members, 

and employees whose classifications require SFA skill as part of their duty statements.

 



 

CPR/AED/First Aid

September 15 and 16, 2014

HQ – Learning and Development Office (LDO)

 

This email is serving as your reminder that there are seats open for Standard First Aid,

HERE’S HOW TO REGISTER:

*      Log in, to the LMS

*      Click, on Self Service-> Request Training-> Search Courses in Catalog

*      Enter, course code 100579

*      Select, session 1219 (9/15) or 1220 (9/16), or any other session that fits your schedule

*      Check, the location you are registering for, as this course is offered throughout the state.

*      Sessions 1219 and 1220 will be delivered at the Caltrans Training Center, 1616 29th St., Sacramento

 

**Note: Enrollment in this course warrants supervisor approval, as there is a charge incurred by your division.**

 

 

If you have any questions, comments or concerns please direct them to the contract manager for SFA:

 

Michael Berlanda

Training Officer I

Learning and Development Office

Division of Safety and Management Services

Office: 916-227-7504

 

Thank You!

Michael Dafferner

Branch Chief

Training, eLearning & Administration Branch

California Department of Transportation

Learning and Development Office

Subject: FW: Introducing a New Statewide Pavement Core Database
Body:
Hi Chuck

 

Can you please forward this note below to the construction RE’s and others who may have core data.

 

We would like to make every effort to get every core we can into the statewide data base for future use.   

 

Thank you,

 

Tom Pyle

Chief, Office of Pavement Management and Data Collection

2389 Gateway Oaks

Sacramento, California  95833

916.274.6188

 

From: Dirrim, Peter W@DOT 
Sent: Wednesday, September 03, 2014 2:07 PM
To: Thorpe, George L@DOT; Mccormick, Terry R@DOT; Housley, Toby B@DOT; Gamboa, Ed O@DOT; Johnson, Glenn A@DOT; Ash, Bryan S@DOT; Barrett, John D@DOT; Jones, David P@DOT; Karlson, Eric@DOT; Evans, David S@DOT
Cc: Ferchaud, Dan R@DOT; Mishra, Tinu@DOT; Chan, Richard@DOT; Mooradian, Ted B@DOT; Stahl, Kirsten R@DOT; Fitzgerald, Tom J@DOT; Berger, Byron J@DOT; Lambert, Bruce W@DOT; Dhillon, Devinder S@DOT; Kean, Bruce W@DOT; Padilla, Art F@DOT; Baseghi, Behdad@DOT
Subject: Introducing a New Statewide Pavement Core Database

 

Pavement Coring Personnel,

 

Caltrans needs to make pavement core data available to all the functional units in the department.  To accomplish this goal a web-based application was developed by the Pavement Program to track and store core data generated by our projects.  The core information is entered via an application developed by UCPRC at UC Davis called iGPR-Core.  This simple application presents all the available core data locations on a Google map where each location can be selected showing detailed core information, as shown below. Currently,  iGPR-Core contains data for over 3,000 cores statewide and new ones get added all the time.  

 



 

Before this application can be used, the user must register to verify their identity.  This requires you to go to the first link below and click on the “Register” button, as shown in the “Login to Site” section above.  A screen will appear where you enter your name, district, a password, a security question and response, then click on the “Create User” button.  After you have registered, you will have to wait for the system administrator to verify the information you have provided.  Two Emails notes will be sent to you, after that you will be able to login with your user name and password.    

 

The link to gain access to the iGPR-Core application is:

 

 http://www.ucprc.ucdavis.edu/igpr-core/ <http://www.ucprc.ucdavis.edu/igpr-core/>  

 

The training materials for this application can be found at:

 

http://onramp.dot.ca.gov/hq/maint/pavement/GPR.shtml <http://onramp.dot.ca.gov/hq/maint/pavement/GPR.shtml> 

 

Please take some time and try this new application, then let me know if it suits your needs and how we could improve it.  In the future, we would like to have the contractor enter data core results directly into this system.

 

 

Peter Dirrim

2386 Gateway Oaks Drive, Suite 200

Sacramento, CA 95833

(916) 274-6071

Subject: PaveM Contract
Body:
Hi John and Zhongren

 

With regard to attached list of projects (RE: PPRC Spending Plan), while there are projects listed, I do not know where they came from.   I would like to start a discussion of how these were developed and examine the estimates.   Please be prepared to make changes to the list.  

 

A good place to start will be the meeting minutes that Jon Lea provided from the October 31, 2013 meeting on “Next Priorities”.    I just have a hard copy of these.  

 

Zhongren will be the lead on reviewing the projects and prioritizing any new tasks to be added.  Please look for a meeting invitation from him.  After we have a first cut of the projects, we will run them past the pavement office chiefs and the SPE, so everyone is aware of what the PaveM priorities are and what the goals for development are.     

 

Thanks,

-Tom

Subject: Overlapping of As-Built Plan Treatments
Body:
Eric and Jeremy, 

 

This is to follow up on our GTM on 8/21/14.  We discussed the issue of the wrongful assignment of treatment for neighboring segments of those shown in as-built plans. At that time, we implemented a rule that the overlapping must be longer than 20% of the neighboring segment length before the neighboring segment takes the treatment shown in the as-built plan. As described on page 23 of the attached document, this rule has some exceptions when the neighboring segment is really short. 

 

*         I suggest that we implement Rule #3. The overlapping length must be longer than 0.1 mile, and must be more than 10% of the neighboring (Red) segment length before the as-built plan treatment is applied to the neighboring segment.

 

Please help verify my reasoning, and help implement in the groovy script. Let me know if you have any questions. (this rule may also have exceptions, but may be more robust than the one we put in currently.)

 

Zhongren 

 

PS, after implementation, please age the network.

Subject: RE: First Step on Normalization.
Body:
As I look at this, I am thinking we should rate the cracking benefit on a scale of 0-100, and IRI benefit on a scale of 0-50 (to show it has less value).  Does this make sense to you?  I think it would show we are working on a scale that people know intuitively.

Body:
I would suggest using the same scale of 0-100. The importance can be reflected using a weight factor when we combine cracking and IRI indices. It will be confusing when you use different scales, esp. we may have a third index called GHG. Also, the addition or combination will be difficult when combining indices with different scales.

Thanks, 

 

Kyle McLean

Project Manager

Cell (408) 858-1370



 

 

 

From: Vergara, Hector@DOT [mailto:hector.vergara@dot.ca.gov] On Behalf Of Coring@DOT
Sent: Monday, September 08, 2014 10:46 AM
To: Kyle McLean; Coring@DOT
Cc: Cook, Christopher@DOT; Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Subject: RE: 05-0L7014 Submittal.73.Data Cores (after coring)

 

Hello Kyle, 

First, thank you for the core information.  Just to let you know, this core information will be used to update our Pavement Management System (PaveM), which has all off the California's highway structural sections in one place.  Being that this information is going into a database, the information needs to be in an electronic format (MS-Excel or Word, or some sort of format that would allow us to rip the information instead of re-typing).  In addition, it is hard to see the core with the pictures being so dark, I am hoping that by stretching the pictures we could see the core layers.  

 

Nevertheless, Caltrans is working on changing the Standard Specifications with this update.  Meanwhile, getting this information electronically now would help this office immensely.  Again, if you could submit the same previously submitted file, but in Excel or Word, we would appreciate it.

 

Second, we have also attached an example of a new Core Submittal Form that Caltrans has been working on in an attempt to standardize the coring submittals.  As you can see, there is a picture of the location of where the core was taken from ("x" marks the spot where the core was taken, see picture below), we use this information to verify the core's GPS coordinates with the Caltrans Photolog and/or Caltrans-Google Map.  Note the post mile paddle in the picture.  In the future, would you please use this form, we would appreciate it.  Caltrans has invested a good amount of money and time on this PaveM project, therefore, these cores are vital to Caltrans.



 

 

Finally, we are also working on being able to load core information on-line in-lieu of hardcopy, where contractors are be able to enter the data information straight into the new PaveM database automatically.  

Here is the links to see all cores:

http://www.ucprc.ucdavis.edu/iGPR/

 

And here is the link to register and load core data, if you choose to. We also added the iGPR Core instructions for your use.

http://www.ucprc.ucdavis.edu/iGPr-core/

 

Thanks again for all your cooperation,

 

Hector Vergara

Division of Maintenance

Pavement Program

Office of Pavement Management & Performance, MS-91

2389 Gateway Oaks Dr., Suite 200

Sacramento, CA 95833

Office: (916) 274-6080

Office of Pavement Management <http://www.dot.ca.gov/hq/maint/Pavement/Pavement_Program/index.html>

From: Dirrim, Peter W@DOT 
Sent: Wednesday, September 03, 2014 2:07 PM
To: Thorpe, George L@DOT; Mccormick, Terry R@DOT; Housley, Toby B@DOT; Gamboa, Ed O@DOT; Johnson, Glenn A@DOT; Ash, Bryan S@DOT; Barrett, John D@DOT; Jones, David P@DOT; Karlson, Eric@DOT; Evans, David S@DOT
Cc: Ferchaud, Dan R@DOT; Mishra, Tinu@DOT; Chan, Richard@DOT; Mooradian, Ted B@DOT; Stahl, Kirsten R@DOT; Fitzgerald, Tom J@DOT; Berger, Byron J@DOT; Lambert, Bruce W@DOT; Dhillon, Devinder S@DOT; Kean, Bruce W@DOT; Padilla, Art F@DOT; Baseghi, Behdad@DOT
Subject: Introducing a New Statewide Pavement Core Database

 

Pavement Coring Personnel,

 

Caltrans needs to make pavement core data available to all the functional units in the department.  To accomplish this goal a web-based application was developed by the Pavement Program to track and store core data generated by our projects.  The core information is entered via an application developed by UCPRC at UC Davis called iGPR-Core.  This simple application presents all the available core data locations on a Google map where each location can be selected showing detailed core information, as shown below. Currently,  iGPR-Core contains data for over 3,000 cores statewide and new ones get added all the time.  

 



 

Before this application can be used, the user must register to verify their identity.  This requires you to go to the first link below and click on the “Register” button, as shown in the “Login to Site” section above.  A screen will appear where you enter your name, district, a password, a security question and response, then click on the “Create User” button.  After you have registered, you will have to wait for the system administrator to verify the information you have provided.  Two Emails notes will be sent to you, after that you will be able to login with your user name and password.    

 

The link to gain access to the iGPR-Core application is:

 

 http://www.ucprc.ucdavis.edu/igpr-core/ <http://www.ucprc.ucdavis.edu/igpr-core/>  

 

The training materials for this application can be found at:

 

http://onramp.dot.ca.gov/hq/maint/pavement/GPR.shtml <http://onramp.dot.ca.gov/hq/maint/pavement/GPR.shtml> 

 

Please take some time and try this new application, then let me know if it suits your needs and how we could improve it.  In the future, we would like to have the contractor enter data core results directly into this system.

 

 

Peter Dirrim

2386 Gateway Oaks Drive, Suite 200

Sacramento, CA 95833

(916) 274-6071

Body:
FYI… 

 

From: Feldman, Dulce R@DOT 
Sent: Wednesday, September 10, 2014 10:17 AM
To: Moreno, Dario L@DOT
Cc: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT; Rosales, Agustin@DOT; Massey, Susan C@DOT; Moore Jr, Bob L@DOT
Subject: RE: Shape File

 

Dario:

 

MANY thanks for creating these shape files.  We sincerely appreciate your help with this…

 

Dulce

 

From: Moreno, Dario L@DOT 
Sent: Wednesday, September 10, 2014 8:33 AM
To: Feldman, Dulce R@DOT
Cc: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT; Rosales, Agustin@DOT; Massey, Susan C@DOT; Moore Jr, Bob L@DOT
Subject: RE: Shape File

 

Without the highway information none of the pavement analysis (from a GIS perspective) is going to happen.  That is the basis for 85% of our GIS analysis.

Not to mention our highway layer.  How long does it take you to generate this file?  

 

I thought Jeff requested this info before he retired 4 weeks ago.  It’s really up to all of you to decide how urgent this information is and if they want you to expedite generating the file.

 

Attached is your shapefile.

 

 

Dario Moreno

GIS Research Program Specialist II

Caltrans|Division of Maintenance

1120 N St., MS31|Sacramento, CA 95814

Office: (916) 654-5402|Cell: (916) 825-7730

Maintenance GIS Intranet <http://onramp.dot.ca.gov/hq/maint/roadway/gis/index.shtml> 

 

From: Feldman, Dulce R@DOT 
Sent: Wednesday, September 10, 2014 8:21 AM
To: Moreno, Dario L@DOT
Cc: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT; Rosales, Agustin@DOT
Subject: RE: Shape File

 

Dario:

 

I will be super booked in the next couple of weeks because of the APCS contract as we are selecting a vendor in two weeks.  Some of my activities include analyzing data, answering RFP questions and evaluate the RFP on one week of September 22nd).  Besides I will be out of town all next week.  

 

In any case I will do my very best to give it to you the sooner I can.  If I could, I would drop everything I have to create the files you need.  Please let me know how urgent it is this file for you.  As you know, you will need to use the last fields I created for your pavement hot dog maps because we have not changed and will not change the highway log for this cycle.  As a result, I do not need to create a new highway log for our PCS crew.   

 

Thanks,


Dulce

 

From: Moreno, Dario L@DOT 
Sent: Wednesday, September 10, 2014 8:05 AM
To: Feldman, Dulce R@DOT
Cc: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT; Rosales, Agustin@DOT
Subject: RE: Shape File

 

I’ll take a look at the data today.

 

When are you planning on downloading a clean roads file?  Jeff would get this file from you between July and August.

We use it to create the TSN highway layer which is our primary information for all pavement analysis.  Could I get this file by next week?

 

Thanks,

 

Dario

 

Dario Moreno

GIS Research Program Specialist II

Subject: FW: Collectin of the off system NHS
Body:
FYI

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT 
Sent: Wednesday, September 10, 2014 10:38 AM
To: Alconcel, Brian W@DOT; Baker, Chad T@DOT
Cc: Feldman, Dulce R@DOT; Samuelson, Mark S@DOT; Sah, Kamal K@DOT; Price, Steve N@DOT
Subject: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Brian, Chad

 

The Pavement Program currently has the APCS contract in advertisement.  I have attached the final bid document.  We start contract evaluation on September 22nd.  

 

I would like to bring you up to date on the schedule.   

 

We expect to award the contract by the middle of October.   It will be shortly after that when we will be able to begin the collection.   In the contract we have allocated for 7000 miles of off-system NHS collection, as is shown in the screen shot of the 1st paragraph below.   The On-system will begin on January 2nd for the entire on-system network, and must be completed with-in 8 months.   The off-system has 12 months for completion.

 



 

Please note there are two things we need from your division:  

1.       We will need the LRS of the off system, to provide to the contractor, for this collection to begin, which will be as early as late October.  

2.       By mid December we must have the updated Caltrans LRS for the contractor to begin that collection.  

 

 

Please let me know when you can provide this information and if you have any questions.

 

Sincerely, 

 

Tom Pyle

Chief, Office of Pavement Management and Performance

Pavement Program

Maintenance Division

2389 Gateway Oaks

Sacramento, California   95833

Subject: Help please
Body:
Eric, 

 

We are trying to add in filters for the ‘reports’, so that jasper reports could be generated based on District, Year, Budget Group, pavement class, etc. So we are in need of your help in locating the query you used to speed up this process. For example, when we select a scenario number and then switch to the Results tab we can see/export the scenario result there. PaveM must have executed a query to generate the result. Can you please send us the Sql query for the scenario results?  

 

Also, can you please upload the query of the view ca_ea_benefit_vw or send us directly? We need these queries to add some fields to the reports.

 

Thank you.

 

Zhongren
CC: (Address): /O=MMS/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=Zhao, Jing@DOc3dc9efb-e895-4718-ab58-360e65c1f3a42a8;/O=MMS/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=Pyle, Thomas d71d6834-6627-4ee8-94be-6b03200da46193e

Subject: FW: Help please
Body:
From: Eric Perrone [mailto:eric@agileassets.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, September 10, 2014 12:16 PM
To: Wang, Zhongren@DOT
Subject: RE: Help please

 

Hey Zhongren,

 

Here is the EA Benefit view…..  the query for the window is not easily obtained.  I can try tomorrow but I am headed to the airport now.  See what you can do with this query in the meantime and I’ll get back to you.

 

Eric

 

CREATE OR REPLACE FORCE VIEW ca_ea_benefit_vw

(

   pms_scenario_id,

   ca_ea_no,

   ca_projectid,

   eff_year,

   lane_miles,

   project_price,

   pms_treatment_id,

   pms_budget_cat_id,

   ca_benefit_pres,

   ca_ben_iri_traffic,

   ca_ghg_diff,

   ca_county_name,

   ca_route_from

)

AS

     SELECT a.pms_scenario_id,

            a.ca_ea_no,

            a.ca_projectid,

            sc.pms_analysis_start_year + a.plan_year AS eff_year,

            SUM (a.lane_miles) AS lane_miles,

            SUM (a.project_price) AS project_price,

            MAX (a.pms_treatment_id) AS pms_treatment_id,

            DECODE (MAX (DECODE (a.pms_budget_cat_id,  8, 1,  1, 2,  5, 3,  4)),  1, 8,  2, 1,  3, 5,  2)

               AS pms_budget_cat_id,

            CASE

               WHEN SUM (a.lane_miles) = 0

               THEN

                  NULL

               ELSE

                  (SUM (a.lane_miles) * SUM (a.ca_benefit_pres_diff * a.lane_miles) / SUM (a.lane_miles))

                  / SUM (a.project_price)

            END

               AS ca_benefit_pres,

            CASE

               WHEN SUM (a.lane_miles) = 0

               THEN

                  NULL

               ELSE

                  (SUM (a.lane_miles) * SUM (a.ca_ben_iri_traffic_diff * a.lane_miles) / SUM (a.lane_miles))

                  / SUM (a.project_price)

            END

               AS ca_ben_iri_traffic,

            CASE

               WHEN SUM (a.lane_miles) = 0

               THEN

                  NULL

               ELSE

                  (SUM (a.lane_miles) * SUM (a.ca_ghg_diff * a.lane_miles) / SUM (a.lane_miles)) / SUM (a.project_price)

            END

               AS ca_ghg,

            REGEXP_REPLACE (listagg (c.ca_county_abbrev, ', ') WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY la.ca_county_from),

                            '([^,]+)(, \1)+',

                            '\1')

               AS ca_county_name,

            -- MAX (la.ca_route_from) AS ca_route_from,

            REGEXP_REPLACE (

               listagg (la.ca_route_from || la.ca_rte_suffix_from, ', ')

                  WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY la.ca_route_from || la.ca_rte_suffix_from),

               '([^,]+)(, \1)+',

               '\1')

               AS ca_route_from

       FROM pms_analysis_scenario_wp a,

            setup_loc_ident la,

            pms_analysis_scenario sc,

            setup_ca_county c

      WHERE     a.loc_ident = la.loc_ident

            AND la.ca_county_from = c.ca_county_id

            AND la.sourse_table = 'PMS_ANALYSIS_SCENARIO_WP'

            AND a.pms_scenario_id = sc.pms_scenario_id

            AND a.ca_ea_no IS NOT NULL

   GROUP BY a.pms_scenario_id,

            a.ca_ea_no,

            sc.pms_analysis_start_year + a.plan_year,

            a.ca_projectid;

Subject: no cutcopypastemove
Body:
'*** In a standard module ***

Option Explicit 

 

Sub ToggleCutCopyAndPaste(Allow As Boolean) 

     'Activate/deactivate cut, copy, paste and pastespecial menu items

    Call EnableMenuItem(21, Allow) ' cut

    Call EnableMenuItem(19, Allow) ' copy

    Call EnableMenuItem(22, Allow) ' paste

    Call EnableMenuItem(755, Allow) ' pastespecial

     

     'Activate/deactivate drag and drop ability

    Application.CellDragAndDrop = Allow 

     

     'Activate/deactivate cut, copy, paste and pastespecial shortcut keys

    With Application 

        Select Case Allow 

        Case Is = False 

            .OnKey "^c", "CutCopyPasteDisabled" 

            .OnKey "^v", "CutCopyPasteDisabled" 

            .OnKey "^x", "CutCopyPasteDisabled" 

            .OnKey "+{DEL}", "CutCopyPasteDisabled" 

            .OnKey "^{INSERT}", "CutCopyPasteDisabled" 

        Case Is = True 

            .OnKey "^c" 

            .OnKey "^v" 

            .OnKey "^x" 

            .OnKey "+{DEL}" 

            .OnKey "^{INSERT}" 

        End Select 

    End With 

End Sub 

 

Sub EnableMenuItem(ctlId As Integer, Enabled As Boolean) 

     'Activate/Deactivate specific menu item

    Dim cBar As CommandBar 

    Dim cBarCtrl As CommandBarControl 

    For Each cBar In Application.CommandBars 

        If cBar.Name <> "Clipboard" Then 

            Set cBarCtrl = cBar.FindControl(ID:=ctlId, recursive:=True) 

            If Not cBarCtrl Is Nothing Then cBarCtrl.Enabled = Enabled 

        End If 

    Next 

End Sub 

 

Sub CutCopyPasteDisabled() 

     'Inform user that the functions have been disabled

    MsgBox "Sorry!  Cutting, copying and pasting have been disabled in this workbook!" 

End Sub 

 

 '*** In the ThisWorkbook Module ***

Option Explicit 

 

Private Sub Workbook_Activate() 

    Call ToggleCutCopyAndPaste(False) 

End Sub 

 

Private Sub Workbook_BeforeClose(Cancel As Boolean) 

    Call ToggleCutCopyAndPaste(True) 

End Sub 

 

Private Sub Workbook_Deactivate() 

    Call ToggleCutCopyAndPaste(True) 

End Sub 

 

Private Sub Workbook_Open() 

    Call ToggleCutCopyAndPaste(False) 

End Sub

Subject: FW: Desired Functional Descriptions
Body:
Hi Eric

 

Here is the excel file for the table we are creating.   Zhongren has listed some of the characteristics we like about it.  

 

-Tom

 

From: Wang, Zhongren@DOT 
Sent: Thursday, September 11, 2014 2:11 PM
To: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Subject: Desired Functional Descriptions 

 

 

 

In selecting projects in PaveM, it is best to display past projects, currently programmed projects, and future planned projects in a time-space diagram as the attached spreadsheet shows. Such a diagram allows the engineers to examine whether the proposed projects make any sense. In our imagination, the diagram could be interactive with the user, integrated with PaveM, and once finalized, could be printed out as reports. 

 

Some of the desired functions are listed below:

1.       Select the time-space window size: # of years, and length of a route to show. One can fix this, too. 20 years vertical, and 50 miles horizontal, for example. The diagram should allow the selection of any Co., Route, and PM limits to show. A reference state map may provide better orientation for the user. 

2.       Plot all historical projects archived in the as-built database;

3.       Select a scenario number, and plot as bar charts, all the programmed, and planned projects, following predefined legends. The bar charts should be able to display lane by lane, if the treatment is different across lanes. 

4.       For the scenario results, the project limits should be interactive, so that the user can stretch/shrink the limits of a certain project. Certainly the labeling should change as the bar size/type of treatment/budget group changes. The bar should also allow to be moved to a different year. In the mean time, such edits should be reflected in a table. 

5.       For each programmed or planned project, there should be a thumbnail display for iVision type of video clip. So that the user can examine the video to assist his/her reasoning. 

6.       This diagram is essentially a GUI.

7.       After all these edits, the edited projects, together with the un-editted projects should become ‘programmed’ projects. These programmed ones should run through PaveM again to determine priority. 

 

Is such a GUI doable? How soon?
CC: (Address): /O=MMS/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=WANG,ZHONGRENd957efa5-36b0-4c27-9125-29a453a523fdf92;/O=MMS/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=Wong, Gerald 155f145a-a58e-4f15-b34c-6dbb8ad95731756;/O=MMS/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=Zhao, Jing@DOc3dc9efb-e895-4718-ab58-360e65c1f3a42a8

Cc: Kanzler, Tori L@DOT; Tyson, Susan R@DOT; Horton, Joseph W@DOT; Mora, Jesus@DOT; Suszko, Charles D@DOT; Adam, John A@DOT; Arnold, Tim J@DOT; Bohannan, Gary M@DOT; Burfield, Curtis B@DOT; Fredrickson, Paul D@DOT; Gilmore III, John L@DOT; MacKenzie III , Robert B@DOT; Martin, Scott P@DOT; Mcmillan, Robert M@DOT; Reynolds, Djenaba C@DOT; Sheahan, Mark C@DOT; Toutges, Sherry Y@DOT; Turner, Mark S@DOT; Waggoner, Manya F@DOT; Wollam, Molly A@DOT
Subject: Design to Paver Event

 

SMB,

 

Attached is my report for the July 9-10, 2014 “Design to Paver” event in Corvallis, Oregon, sponsored by FHWA and hosted by ODOT. It was a great honor to have been selected to attend, and I am very grateful to those who approved Caltrans participation.  I was joined by Chuck Suszko, Division of Construction and Jesus Mora, Division of Design.  

 

https://media.oregonstate.edu/media/t/0_mp6bwlov <https://media.oregonstate.edu/media/t/0_mp6bwlov> 

 

I’ve incorporated a number of links from the event, as well as other related resources into the report to make it a “virtual” tour of the workshop for those unable to attend. I’ve shared this report with the HQ’s Project Delivery Division Chiefs and co-attendees, and received positive reaction. 

 

I would encourage the readers of this report to take the Self Assessment tool, attached, to gauge the level of maturity where they see we are “currently” with implementing these new technologies and paradigms across Caltrans. Outreach, training and education, are as critical as the new technologies/hardware/software, as well the need to update policies and guidance, procedures, etc.   

 

I am hopeful as we move from EDC2 to EDC3, we will continue to provide leadership by implementing these innovations as the building blocks for the future digital transportation infrastructure.   

 

Please feel free to pass along to your staff, others, including Design, Right of Way, Construction, Project Management, etc.    

 

Let me know if you have any questions or concerns. 

 

Mark S. Turner, P.L.S.

Chief, Office of Land Surveys 

Division of Right of Way and Land Surveys 

California Department of Transportation

3 staff in Leadership Trng  ?          Does this get charged to Division of Mtce or pavement pgm?

Printers                               $8,000   We ordered 2 of them last year.  Payment will hit this year.  They are expensive to be able to print GIS maps on 11” X 17” at GWO and Lab

Susan

Subject: RE: Action Items from today

 

Hello there!

 

Please keep in mind whatever proposals you come up with,  they will need to first be vetted through our Division Chief.

 

If our DC approves then, from there, the districts will need to be contacted (the DDDM’s).

 

The intention of my email is to be transparent, with you both.  I don’t want to leave you with the impression that I have the authority to authorize resources from the districts.

 

The sooner you come up with your estimates,  the sooner I can run them through Melodie and then Tony.

Subject: FW: Action Items from today

 

Thank you for your time today:

 

Wanted to re-cap the action items and a few discussions:

 

Action Items from Today’s meeting

 

*  13/14 Year end numbers “close out” number for the Pavement Office – Mohamed will provide by 09/03/2014 using AP 14 

*  Unit clean-up; We have all that is needed to do this, Mohamed will continue with the exercise and have this done by 09/12/2014

*  Training Allocation – Compile a list of needs and submit to the Budget Office (3 year expenditure data provided no allocation to the Pavement Offices) – Susan will provide this by _____?

*  Mohamed is going to perform additional research to determine why Training expenditures did not materialize in the 3 year historical expenditures

*  Currently we have set aside $355,000 set aside for PaveM (nick)

*  Currently we have set aside $4,000,000 for APCS

*  Cell phone/Communication costs needed to be spread to the Offices and not reflect only the the executive unit – Mohamed will do this and resend your MBS’s by 09/03/2014

*  Sri will put together the planned work from each district and identify the resources associated with this work – A subsequent dialog will need to occur with Sri, Mel and myself on how we want this to potentially roll out to the districts

*  Susan wanted all the columns hidden in your MBS for those object classes which show no allocation nor expenditures.

 

 

The following are still pending action items from our last meeting.

*  Finance Letter resources Perm $$ of 355K – I will communicate with Melodie what has been set aside and attempt to get that allocated asap (We will need to get final approval from our Div Chief)

*  For 15/16 identify Off the Top needs for Pavement from prior Finance letter resources that have now melded into our “Base” – The goal was to have the OTT’s on going from fy to fy (perpetual) 

 

 

From: Sommer, Michelle L@DOT 
Sent: Thursday, July 24, 2014 10:32 AM
To: Mansy, Mohamed W@DOT; Benipal, Amarjeet S@DOT; Massey, Susan C@DOT; Dayton, Charles M@DOT
Subject: FW: Action Items from today

 

Team:

 

I’m re-capping the action items from today’s meeting.

 

*  We will utilize source unit 3476 for Amarjeet and change the description to match his current function.  Currently Allocation is to the 3476 unit #, the goal is to align expenditures with allocations

*  Encumbrance report – Mohamed will send this with the detailed information requested, so an effort can begin on researching original documents/transactions– Our goals is to spend old money first, and release any unnecessary encumbrances from prior fiscal years

*  Breakdown expenditures from 13/14 and display expenditure items in the comparison report we went over this morning.

*  Unit number clean up (rid all  references to D45, and update descriptions where necessary)

*  Finance Letter resources Perm $$ of 355K – I will communicate with Melodie what has been set aside and attempt to get that allocated asap (We will need to get final approval from our Div Chief)

*  For 15/16 identify Off the Top needs for Pavement from prior Finance letter resources that have now melded into our “Base” – The goal was to have the OTT’s on going from fy to fy (perpetual) 

*  Follow up meeting to be scheduled to review and discuss action items and roll out the 14/15 budgeted resources to the remaining Pavement O/C’s

 

 

I hope I captured everything.

 

Susan – I will schedule a meeting in a couple of weeks with you and the Pavement O/C’s – Mohamed and I will come to Ventura Oaks 

 

Thank you very much for taking the time to meet with us.  We look forward to working with you the remainder of the fiscal year.

Hi Chad

 

This is great news.  


Thank you.  (I usually don’t include an army of cc’s, but this is such great news, thought everyone would like to see it.)

 

-Tom  

 

From: Baker, Chad T@DOT 
Sent: Monday, September 15, 2014 12:06 PM
To: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Cc: Alconcel, Brian W@DOT
Subject: RE: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Hi Tom,

 

We are on track to deliver the on-system LRS by October 6th (original estimate was September 22nd) which includes updates for the 37 routes with identified changes between the Jan 30, 2012  and Jan 30, 2014 TSN data queries.

 

I’ll let Brian cover the off-system LRS item.

 

Thanks,

Chad Baker, Chief

Office of Data Services and Technology

Division of Research, Innovation and System Information

1120 N Street, MS 83 - Sacramento, CA - 95814

916-651-5720

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT 
Sent: Monday, September 15, 2014 11:33 AM
To: Baker, Chad T@DOT; Alconcel, Brian W@DOT
Subject: FW: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Gentlemen

 

Please see the green highlight below…

 

The Pavement Program will need for you to provide the LRS for the off-system collection, which can begin as soon as the contract s awarded.   

 

Also, I will need the LRS for the Caltrans On-system by Mid December.  

 

When will these be delivered?  

 

Thank You,

 

-Tom

274.6188

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT 
Sent: Wednesday, September 10, 2014 10:38 AM
To: Alconcel, Brian W@DOT; Baker, Chad T@DOT
Cc: Feldman, Dulce R@DOT; Samuelson, Mark S@DOT; Sah, Kamal K@DOT; Price, Steve N@DOT
Subject: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Brian, Chad

 

The Pavement Program currently has the APCS contract in advertisement.  I have attached the final bid document.  We start contract evaluation on September 22nd.  

 

I would like to bring you up to date on the schedule.   

 

We expect to award the contract by the middle of October.   It will be shortly after that when we will be able to begin the collection.   In the contract we have allocated for 7000 miles of off-system NHS collection, as is shown in the screen shot of the 1st paragraph below.   The On-system will begin on January 2nd for the entire on-system network, and must be completed with-in 8 months.   The off-system has 12 months for completion.

 



 

Please note there are two things we need from your division:  

1.       We will need the LRS of the off system, to provide to the contractor, for this collection to begin, which will be as early as late October.  

2.       By mid December we must have the updated Caltrans LRS for the contractor to begin that collection.  

 

 

Please let me know when you can provide this information and if you have any questions.

 

Sincerely, 

 

Tom Pyle

Chief, Office of Pavement Management and Performance

Pavement Program

Maintenance Division

2389 Gateway Oaks

Sacramento, California   95833

916.274.6188

Subject: Updating as-builts

Hi,

Is anyone running anything that would prevent me updating the as-builts with Hector's latest data?  After the update the Network Master (8a/Fine segmentation) will need to be updated and aged, and then the special scenario for the Coarse segmentation run, before uploading that and completely replacing the current Coarse segmentation.

Regards,
  -Jeremy

Subject: FW: Collection of the off system NHS
Body:
FYI

 

From: Alconcel, Brian W@DOT 
Sent: Monday, September 15, 2014 1:08 PM
To: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT; Baker, Chad T@DOT
Cc: Feldman, Dulce R@DOT; Sah, Kamal K@DOT; Briseno, Socorro A@DOT
Subject: RE: Collection of the off system NHS

 

Tom,

 

I’m not the expert on LRS but I can attempt to answer your question.  For the off-system LRS, I reported the following to the Traffic Records Steering Committee, on behalf of our two offices:

*         June 16, 2014, a California, All Public Roads, LRS was submitted and accepted by FHWA, which met the federal requirement of ARNOLD.

o   The LRS that was submitted can be shared with our partners.  

o   There are standards for mapping data on the LRS which include a Route ID, Begin measures and End measures.

*         This completes Phase 1 of our efforts.

*         Phase 2 will be to make sure that attributes can be dynamically segmented onto the LRS, which is scheduled for completion by June 15, 2015, our next HPMS submittal.

 

Chad, correct me if I’m wrong but Phase 2 is what we are working on with the CSUs, with a goal to complete by May 1, 2014, and this effort is being led by your office.  It was supposed to have been completed by the last HPMS submittal but due to issues with the HPMS data, they did not accomplish the original scope.  This means that we do not have an automated way to provide GIS information for the off-system pavement data.  

 

That is why I explained to Dulce that it would be more difficult to provide shape files for the off-system compared to on-system.  It would require Chad’s staff to manually locate each area and create a shape file from scratch.  Our cracking length contractor was able to do this for us.  I could ask Kamal to provide you with the details of our off system pavement contract for cracking length.  In hind sight, we probably should have combined our efforts for all pavement data.  Our contractor mentioned that if we added IRI it wouldn’t have changed the bid.

 

Let me know if you would like to discuss,

 

Brian Alconcel, Acting Chief

Office of Highway System Information & Performance

Division of Research, Innovation, & System Information

California Department of Transportation

916-654-3995 (Office)

916-969-6186 (Cell)

Subject: RE: Help please
Body:
Are you looking for the query that populates the work plan grid in the scenario screen?

 

From: Wang, Zhongren@DOT [mailto:zhongren.wang@dot.ca.gov] 
Sent: Tuesday, September 16, 2014 10:49 AM
To: Eric Perrone
Cc: Zhao, Jing@DOT
Subject: FW: Help please

 

This is another loose ends we would like to tie up. Jing is in need of the query. Please help. Thank you. Zhongren

 

From: Wang, Zhongren@DOT 
Sent: Wednesday, September 10, 2014 11:59 AM
To: Eric Perrone; Wong, Gerry C@DOT
Cc: Zhao, Jing@DOT; Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Subject: Help please

 

Eric, 

 

We are trying to add in filters for the ‘reports’, so that jasper reports could be generated based on District, Year, Budget Group, pavement class, etc. So we are in need of your help in locating the query you used to speed up this process. For example, when we select a scenario number and then switch to the Results tab we can see/export the scenario result there. PaveM must have executed a query to generate the result. Can you please send us the Sql query for the scenario results?

Body:

Thank you Kamal
