-Tom  

 

 

From: Sah, Kamal K@DOT 
Sent: Monday, September 15, 2014 3:23 PM
To: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Cc: Alconcel, Brian W@DOT; Baker, Chad T@DOT; Feldman, Dulce R@DOT; Briseno, Socorro A@DOT
Subject: RE: Collection of the off system NHS
Importance: High

 

Hi Tom,

 

Attached is the spreadsheet of off-system routes, with their beginning and end measures. This should help meet the RFP requirements on page 81, paragraph 2.2 to provide the off-system LRS. The total length of IRI is 4,733 miles. Please let Brian and I know if there is more information you may need from us. Thank you!

 

 

Kamal Sah, P.E. 

Acting HPMS Branch Chief

Division of Research, Innnovation, and System Information (DRISI)

Caltrans

(916) 653-2808

E-mail: kamal.sah@dot.ca.gov <mailto:kamal.sah@dot.ca.gov> 

 

From: Alconcel, Brian W@DOT 
Sent: Monday, September 15, 2014 1:08 PM
To: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT; Baker, Chad T@DOT
Cc: Feldman, Dulce R@DOT; Sah, Kamal K@DOT; Briseno, Socorro A@DOT
Subject: RE: Collection of the off system NHS

 

Tom,

 

I’m not the expert on LRS but I can attempt to answer your question.  For the off-system LRS, I reported the following to the Traffic Records Steering Committee, on behalf of our two offices:

*         June 16, 2014, a California, All Public Roads, LRS was submitted and accepted by FHWA, which met the federal requirement of ARNOLD.

o   The LRS that was submitted can be shared with our partners.  

o   There are standards for mapping data on the LRS which include a Route ID, Begin measures and End measures.

*         This completes Phase 1 of our efforts.

*         Phase 2 will be to make sure that attributes can be dynamically segmented onto the LRS, which is scheduled for completion by June 15, 2015, our next HPMS submittal.

 

Chad, correct me if I’m wrong but Phase 2 is what we are working on with the CSUs, with a goal to complete by May 1, 2014, and this effort is being led by your office.  It was supposed to have been completed by the last HPMS submittal but due to issues with the HPMS data, they did not accomplish the original scope.  This means that we do not have an automated way to provide GIS information for the off-system pavement data.  

 

That is why I explained to Dulce that it would be more difficult to provide shape files for the off-system compared to on-system.  It would require Chad’s staff to manually locate each area and create a shape file from scratch.  Our cracking length contractor was able to do this for us.  I could ask Kamal to provide you with the details of our off system pavement contract for cracking length.  In hind sight, we probably should have combined our efforts for all pavement data.  Our contractor mentioned that if we added IRI it wouldn’t have changed the bid.

 

Let me know if you would like to discuss,

 

Brian Alconcel, Acting Chief

Office of Highway System Information & Performance

Division of Research, Innovation, & System Information

California Department of Transportation

916-654-3995 (Office)

916-969-6186 (Cell)

 

From: Baker, Chad T@DOT 
Sent: Monday, September 15, 2014 12:06 PM
To: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Cc: Alconcel, Brian W@DOT
Subject: RE: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Hi Tom,

 

We are on track to deliver the on-system LRS by October 6th (original estimate was September 22nd) which includes updates for the 37 routes with identified changes between the Jan 30, 2012  and Jan 30, 2014 TSN data queries.

 

I’ll let Brian cover the off-system LRS item.

 

Thanks,

Chad Baker, Chief

Gentlemen

 

Please see the green highlight below…

 

The Pavement Program will need for you to provide the LRS for the off-system collection, which can begin as soon as the contract s awarded.   

 

Also, I will need the LRS for the Caltrans On-system by Mid December.  

 

When will these be delivered?  

 

Thank You,

 

-Tom

274.6188

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT 
Sent: Wednesday, September 10, 2014 10:38 AM
To: Alconcel, Brian W@DOT; Baker, Chad T@DOT
Cc: Feldman, Dulce R@DOT; Samuelson, Mark S@DOT; Sah, Kamal K@DOT; Price, Steve N@DOT
Subject: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Brian, Chad

 

The Pavement Program currently has the APCS contract in advertisement.  I have attached the final bid document.  We start contract evaluation on September 22nd.  

 

I would like to bring you up to date on the schedule.   

 

We expect to award the contract by the middle of October.   It will be shortly after that when we will be able to begin the collection.   In the contract we have allocated for 7000 miles of off-system NHS collection, as is shown in the screen shot of the 1st paragraph below.   The On-system will begin on January 2nd for the entire on-system network, and must be completed with-in 8 months.   The off-system has 12 months for completion.

 



 

Please note there are two things we need from your division:  

1.       We will need the LRS of the off system, to provide to the contractor, for this collection to begin, which will be as early as late October.  

2.       By mid December we must have the updated Caltrans LRS for the contractor to begin that collection.  

 

 

Please let me know when you can provide this information and if you have any questions.

 

Sincerely, 

 

Tom Pyle

Chief, Office of Pavement Management and Performance

Pavement Program

Maintenance Division

2389 Gateway Oaks

Sacramento, California   95833

Subject: Help please

 

Eric, 

 

We are trying to add in filters for the ‘reports’, so that jasper reports could be generated based on District, Year, Budget Group, pavement class, etc. So we are in need of your help in locating the query you used to speed up this process. For example, when we select a scenario number and then switch to the Results tab we can see/export the scenario result there. PaveM must have executed a query to generate the result. Can you please send us the Sql query for the scenario results?  

 

Also, can you please upload the query of the view ca_ea_benefit_vw or send us directly? We need these queries to add some fields to the reports.

 

Thank you.

 

Zhongren
CC: (Address): /O=MMS/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=Zhao, Jing@DOc3dc9efb-e895-4718-ab58-360e65c1f3a42a8

Subject: RE: Help please
Body:
Here is the best I can do on that query should be pretty close the parameter is the scenario number…

 

select

(100*BENEFIT*LANE_MILES/PROJECT_PRICE) as BENEFIT,

(select b.offset_from from setup_loc_ident b where a.loc_ident=b.loc_ident and b.sourse_table='PMS_ANALYSIS_SCENARIO_WP') as CA_BEG_STODM,

(10000*a.CA_BENEFIT_PRES_DIFF*a.LANE_MILES/a.PROJECT_PRICE) as CA_BENEFIT_PRES,

(100*CA_BEN_IRI_RUC_DIFF*LANE_MILES/PROJECT_PRICE) as CA_BEN_IRI_RUC,

(10000*CA_BEN_IRI_TRAFFIC_DIFF*LANE_MILES/PROJECT_PRICE) as CA_BEN_IRI_TRAFFIC,

(10000*CA_BEN_IRI_TRAF_PRES_DIFF*LANE_MILES/PROJECT_PRICE) as CA_BEN_IRI_TRAF_PRES,

(       SELECT MIN (b.ca_class_no)

          FROM network_master b, setup_loc_ident la, setup_loc_ident lb

         WHERE     a.loc_ident = la.loc_ident

               AND la.sourse_table = 'PMS_ANALYSIS_SCENARIO_WP'

               AND b.loc_ident = lb.loc_ident

               AND lb.sourse_table = 'NETWORK_MASTER'

               AND la.route_id = lb.route_id

               AND (la.lane_dir = lb.lane_dir OR la.lane_dir = 0 OR lb.lane_dir = 0)

               AND (la.lane_id = lb.lane_id OR la.lane_id = 0 OR lb.lane_id = 0)

               AND la.offset_from < lb.offset_to

               AND la.offset_to > lb.offset_from) as CA_CLASS_NO,

(select c.CA_COUNTY_ABBREV from SETUP_CA_COUNTY c where b.CA_COUNTY_FROM=c.CA_COUNTY_ID) as CA_COUNTY_FROM,

(nvl(( select max(lpad(ca_district_id,2,'0')) from PMS_CA_DISTRICT_EXCEPT ex, setup_loc_ident sli, setup_loc_ident la

where ex.loc_ident=sli.loc_ident and SLI.SOURSE_TABLE='PMS_CA_DISTRICT_EXCEPT' 

and a.loc_ident = la.loc_ident

and la.sourse_table='PMS_ANALYSIS_SCENARIO_WP'

and sli.route_id=LA.ROUTE_ID

and (la.lane_id=0 or sli.lane_id=0 or sli.lane_id=la.lane_id)

and (la.lane_dir=0 or sli.lane_dir=0 or sli.lane_dir=la.lane_dir)

and SLI.OFFSET_FROM<lA.OFFSET_TO

and SLI.OFFSET_TO>lA.OFFSET_FROM),(select d.ca_district_code from setup_ca_district d, setup_loc_ident la, setup_ca_county co

where a.loc_ident=la.loc_ident and la.sourse_table='PMS_ANALYSIS_SCENARIO_WP'

and la.ca_county_from=co.ca_county_id and co.ca_district_id=d.ca_district_id))) as CA_DISTRICT_CODE,

a.CA_EA_NO,

(select b.offset_to from setup_loc_ident b where a.loc_ident=b.loc_ident and b.sourse_table='PMS_ANALYSIS_SCENARIO_WP') as CA_END_STODM,

(10000*CA_GHG_DIFF*LANE_MILES/PROJECT_PRICE) as CA_GHG,

a.CA_IS_NHS,

b.CA_PM_PREFIX_FROM,

b.CA_PM_PREFIX_TO,

b.CA_PM_SUFFIX_FROM,

b.CA_PM_SUFFIX_TO,

b.CA_POSTMILE_BEG,

b.CA_POSTMILE_END,

a.CA_PROJECTID,

(select c.ROUTE_NAME from ROUTE_LIST c where b.CA_ROUTE_FROM=c.CA_ROUTE_FROM) as CA_ROUTE_FROM,

b.CA_RTE_SUFFIX_FROM,

(select a.PLAN_YEAR +b.PMS_ANALYSIS_START_YEAR-nvl(b.POSTPONE_DETERIORATION,0) from pms_analysis_scenario b where a.pms_scenario_id=b.pms_scenario_id) as EFF_YEAR,

(select c.LANE_DIR_NAME from SETUP_LANE_DIR c where b.LANE_DIR=c.LANE_DIR) as LANE_DIR,

(select c.LANE_ID_NAME from SETUP_LANE_ID c where b.LANE_ID=c.LANE_ID) as LANE_ID,

a.LANE_MILES,

a.LENGTH,

a.LOC_IDENT,

(select c.MWP_PROJECT_STATUS_NAME from SETUP_MWP_PROJECT_STATUS c where a.MWP_PROJECT_STATUS_ID=c.MWP_PROJECT_STATUS_ID) as MWP_PROJECT_STATUS_ID,

a.PLAN_YEAR,

(select c.PMS_BUDGET_CAT_NAME from PMS_BUDGET_CAT c where a.PMS_BUDGET_CAT_ID=c.PMS_BUDGET_CAT_ID) as PMS_BUDGET_CAT_ID,

a.PMS_SECTION_ID,

(select c.PMS_TREATMENT_NAME from MS_TREATMENT c where a.PMS_TREATMENT_ID=c.PMS_TREATMENT_ID) as PMS_TREATMENT_ID,

a.PROJECT_PRICE,

(select c.WC_NAME from PMS_WC c where a.WC_ID=c.WC_ID) as WC_ID

from pms_analysis_scenario_wp a, setup_loc_ident b

where A.LOC_IDENT=B.LOC_IDENT and B.SOURSE_TABLE='PMS_ANALYSIS_SCENARIO_WP'  and A.PMS_SCENARIO_ID=:PMS_SCENARIO_ID

To: Eric Perrone; Wong, Gerry C@DOT
Cc: Zhao, Jing@DOT; Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Subject: Help please

 

Eric, 

 

We are trying to add in filters for the ‘reports’, so that jasper reports could be generated based on District, Year, Budget Group, pavement class, etc. So we are in need of your help in locating the query you used to speed up this process. For example, when we select a scenario number and then switch to the Results tab we can see/export the scenario result there. PaveM must have executed a query to generate the result. Can you please send us the Sql query for the scenario results?  

 

Also, can you please upload the query of the view ca_ea_benefit_vw or send us directly? We need these queries to add some fields to the reports.

 

Thank you.

 

Zhongren
CC: (Address): /O=MMS/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=Zhao, Jing@DOc3dc9efb-e895-4718-ab58-360e65c1f3a42a8

Subject: RE: Help please
Body:
Thank you so much. 

 

Also, Jeremy is uploading the latest as-builts. After that, we are going to re-create the coarse segmentation files. We may need you help to age and replace the existing coarse segmentation really quickly. 

 

Zhongren

 

From: Eric Perrone [mailto:eric@agileassets.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, September 16, 2014 8:35 AM
To: Wang, Zhongren@DOT
Cc: Zhao, Jing@DOT
Subject: RE: Help please

 

Here is the best I can do on that query should be pretty close the parameter is the scenario number…

 

select

(100*BENEFIT*LANE_MILES/PROJECT_PRICE) as BENEFIT,

(select b.offset_from from setup_loc_ident b where a.loc_ident=b.loc_ident and b.sourse_table='PMS_ANALYSIS_SCENARIO_WP') as CA_BEG_STODM,

(10000*a.CA_BENEFIT_PRES_DIFF*a.LANE_MILES/a.PROJECT_PRICE) as CA_BENEFIT_PRES,

(100*CA_BEN_IRI_RUC_DIFF*LANE_MILES/PROJECT_PRICE) as CA_BEN_IRI_RUC,

(10000*CA_BEN_IRI_TRAFFIC_DIFF*LANE_MILES/PROJECT_PRICE) as CA_BEN_IRI_TRAFFIC,

(10000*CA_BEN_IRI_TRAF_PRES_DIFF*LANE_MILES/PROJECT_PRICE) as CA_BEN_IRI_TRAF_PRES,

(       SELECT MIN (b.ca_class_no)

          FROM network_master b, setup_loc_ident la, setup_loc_ident lb

         WHERE     a.loc_ident = la.loc_ident

               AND la.sourse_table = 'PMS_ANALYSIS_SCENARIO_WP'

               AND b.loc_ident = lb.loc_ident

               AND lb.sourse_table = 'NETWORK_MASTER'

               AND la.route_id = lb.route_id

               AND (la.lane_dir = lb.lane_dir OR la.lane_dir = 0 OR lb.lane_dir = 0)

               AND (la.lane_id = lb.lane_id OR la.lane_id = 0 OR lb.lane_id = 0)

               AND la.offset_from < lb.offset_to

               AND la.offset_to > lb.offset_from) as CA_CLASS_NO,

(select c.CA_COUNTY_ABBREV from SETUP_CA_COUNTY c where b.CA_COUNTY_FROM=c.CA_COUNTY_ID) as CA_COUNTY_FROM,

(nvl(( select max(lpad(ca_district_id,2,'0')) from PMS_CA_DISTRICT_EXCEPT ex, setup_loc_ident sli, setup_loc_ident la

where ex.loc_ident=sli.loc_ident and SLI.SOURSE_TABLE='PMS_CA_DISTRICT_EXCEPT' 

and a.loc_ident = la.loc_ident

and la.sourse_table='PMS_ANALYSIS_SCENARIO_WP'

and sli.route_id=LA.ROUTE_ID

and (la.lane_id=0 or sli.lane_id=0 or sli.lane_id=la.lane_id)

and (la.lane_dir=0 or sli.lane_dir=0 or sli.lane_dir=la.lane_dir)

and SLI.OFFSET_FROM<lA.OFFSET_TO

and SLI.OFFSET_TO>lA.OFFSET_FROM),(select d.ca_district_code from setup_ca_district d, setup_loc_ident la, setup_ca_county co

where a.loc_ident=la.loc_ident and la.sourse_table='PMS_ANALYSIS_SCENARIO_WP'

and la.ca_county_from=co.ca_county_id and co.ca_district_id=d.ca_district_id))) as CA_DISTRICT_CODE,

a.CA_EA_NO,

(select b.offset_to from setup_loc_ident b where a.loc_ident=b.loc_ident and b.sourse_table='PMS_ANALYSIS_SCENARIO_WP') as CA_END_STODM,

(10000*CA_GHG_DIFF*LANE_MILES/PROJECT_PRICE) as CA_GHG,

a.CA_IS_NHS,

b.CA_PM_PREFIX_FROM,

b.CA_PM_PREFIX_TO,

b.CA_PM_SUFFIX_FROM,

b.CA_PM_SUFFIX_TO,

b.CA_POSTMILE_BEG,

b.CA_POSTMILE_END,

a.CA_PROJECTID,

(select c.ROUTE_NAME from ROUTE_LIST c where b.CA_ROUTE_FROM=c.CA_ROUTE_FROM) as CA_ROUTE_FROM,

b.CA_RTE_SUFFIX_FROM,

(select a.PLAN_YEAR +b.PMS_ANALYSIS_START_YEAR-nvl(b.POSTPONE_DETERIORATION,0) from pms_analysis_scenario b where a.pms_scenario_id=b.pms_scenario_id) as EFF_YEAR,

(select c.LANE_DIR_NAME from SETUP_LANE_DIR c where b.LANE_DIR=c.LANE_DIR) as LANE_DIR,

(select c.LANE_ID_NAME from SETUP_LANE_ID c where b.LANE_ID=c.LANE_ID) as LANE_ID,

a.LANE_MILES,

a.LENGTH,

a.LOC_IDENT,

(select c.MWP_PROJECT_STATUS_NAME from SETUP_MWP_PROJECT_STATUS c where a.MWP_PROJECT_STATUS_ID=c.MWP_PROJECT_STATUS_ID) as MWP_PROJECT_STATUS_ID,

a.PLAN_YEAR,

(select c.PMS_BUDGET_CAT_NAME from PMS_BUDGET_CAT c where a.PMS_BUDGET_CAT_ID=c.PMS_BUDGET_CAT_ID) as PMS_BUDGET_CAT_ID,

a.PMS_SECTION_ID,

(select c.PMS_TREATMENT_NAME from MS_TREATMENT c where a.PMS_TREATMENT_ID=c.PMS_TREATMENT_ID) as PMS_TREATMENT_ID,

a.PROJECT_PRICE,

(select c.WC_NAME from PMS_WC c where a.WC_ID=c.WC_ID) as WC_ID

from pms_analysis_scenario_wp a, setup_loc_ident b

where A.LOC_IDENT=B.LOC_IDENT and B.SOURSE_TABLE='PMS_ANALYSIS_SCENARIO_WP'  and A.PMS_SCENARIO_ID=:PMS_SCENARIO_ID

Subject: FW: Itinerary for THOMAS A PYLE on 9/17/14 to Los Angeles
Body:
Reminder

 

Tomorrow I will be in Southern California.  I have a meeting with the developers of NCHRP study 169 (which I will forward under a separate email).

 

Also, I will be in late on Thursday as I have a vet appointment and an appt with my Internet Service Provider.  

 

-Tom

Subject: FW: NCHRP IDEA Project 169 - 5th quarterly report
Body:
Topic of meeting tomorrow…. 

 

From: Burcin Becerik [mailto:becerik@usc.edu] 
Sent: Monday, June 02, 2014 10:23 AM
To: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Cc: Sami F Masri; Mohammad R. Jahanshahi
Subject: NCHRP IDEA Project 169 - 5th quarterly report

 

Dear Tom,

 

Please find the attached 5th quarterly report of our project (NCHRP IDEA Project 169: An Inexpensive Vision-Based Approach for the Autonomous Detection, Localization, and Quantification of Pavement Defects). 

 

We would like to invite you to USC as we would like to update you on the details of our project and also to get your input/feedback. Alternatively, we can also meet you at your office. Can you please provide us couple time slots in June? 

 

We are looking forward to hearing back from you. 

---

Burcin Becerik-Gerber

Assistant Professor and Stephen Schrank Early Career Chair in Civil and Environmental Engineering

USC, Sonny Astani Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering

3620 S. Vermont Avenue, Kaprielian Hall 224C, Los Angeles, CA 90089-2531

(T) 213 740 4383 (F) 213 744 1426 (E) becerik@usc.edu <mailto:becerik@usc.edu>  

http://i-lab.usc.edu/

Subject: Re: Message from Jing.
Body:
Hi Jing. 

Congratulations on your permanent job! You have worked hard through college to get this position. I am happy for, but very sorry to see you leave us soon. You are doing great work for us and it is much appreciated. I'll keep my eyes out for that janitor engineer job... :) 

-Tom

Subject: Red Yellow and Green mileage for Class 3 Road
Body:
Eric, 

Remember we classified the 50k lane miles into Green Yellow, and Red about a month ago? Now we are in need classifying Class 3 road into Green, Yellow, and Red using the same thresholds we used. Could you please help me add some routine like this shown below, but for class 3 road only? I will also need a report to display that. 

Jing also has some question for you. Will it be okay for us to have a GTM tomorrow morning, say 9am PST?

Zhongren

Enclosure: 

   nmf.ca_ppl_code_id,
          CASE
             WHEN nmf_det.wc_id = 1 -- flexible
             THEN
                CASE
                   WHEN nmf_det.ca_wpcv < 5 THEN 1
                   WHEN nmf_det.ca_wpcv BETWEEN 5 AND 10 THEN 2
                   WHEN nmf_det.ca_wpcv > 10 THEN 3
                   ELSE NULL
                END
             WHEN nmf_det.wc_id = 2  -- rigid
             THEN
                CASE
                   WHEN nmf_det.ca_apcs_jpc_ck3_pct < 1.5 THEN 1
                   WHEN nmf_det.ca_apcs_jpc_ck3_pct BETWEEN 1.5 AND 3 THEN 2
                   WHEN nmf_det.ca_apcs_jpc_ck3_pct > 3 THEN 3
                   ELSE NULL
                END
             ELSE
                NULL
          END
             AS ca_needs_cat_id
CC: (Name): Wong, Gerry C@DOT;Zhao, Jing@DOT;Vergara, Hector@DOT;Pyle, Thomas A@DOT

Cc: Wong, Gerry C@DOT; Zhao, Jing@DOT; Vergara, Hector@DOT; Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Subject: Red Yellow and Green mileage for Class 3 Road

Eric,

Remember we classified the 50k lane miles into Green Yellow, and Red about a month ago? Now we are in need classifying Class 3 road into Green, Yellow, and Red using the same thresholds we used. Could you please help me add some routine like this shown below, but for class 3 road only? I will also need a report to display that.

Jing also has some question for you. Will it be okay for us to have a GTM tomorrow morning, say 9am PST?

Zhongren

Enclosure:

   nmf.ca_ppl_code_id,
          CASE
             WHEN nmf_det.wc_id = 1 -- flexible
             THEN
                CASE
                   WHEN nmf_det.ca_wpcv < 5 THEN 1
                   WHEN nmf_det.ca_wpcv BETWEEN 5 AND 10 THEN 2
                   WHEN nmf_det.ca_wpcv > 10 THEN 3
                   ELSE NULL
                END
             WHEN nmf_det.wc_id = 2  -- rigid
             THEN
                CASE
                   WHEN nmf_det.ca_apcs_jpc_ck3_pct < 1.5 THEN 1
                   WHEN nmf_det.ca_apcs_jpc_ck3_pct BETWEEN 1.5 AND 3 THEN 2
                   WHEN nmf_det.ca_apcs_jpc_ck3_pct > 3 THEN 3
                   ELSE NULL
                END
             ELSE
                NULL
          END
             AS ca_needs_cat_id

Subject: Fwd: Residence At Milford Tower
Body:
??? iPhone ??

???????



	???: propmgr@residenceatmilfordtower.com <mailto:propmgr@residenceatmilfordtower.com> 
	??: September 18, 2014, 7:45:30 AM PDT
	???: terry_amy2000@yahoo.com <mailto:terry_amy2000@yahoo.com> 
	??: Residence At Milford Tower
	
	

	Just to reiterate some of the details again:
	 
	1br rents for $495/mo. A month to month or 3 month lease is an additional monthly fee of $100, bringing the rent to $595/mo. A 6 mos lease is an additional $50.00, bringing the rent to $545/mo. Upon approval, a hold fee is required which is non refundable after 72 hours, and secures the apt for you for 30 days. This is applied to your deposit, lowering it to $300 the day of move in along with the rent(which will be prorated if moved in after the 1st). We pay water, sewer and trash, and the tenant is responsible for electric which typically runs about $45-$60 per month. We have coin operated washers and dryers in each building. Please include his offer letter, as this will speed up the process much quicker. We do a background check, check rental history and he must earn $1487.50 for a $595 and $1287.50 for $495. Please include his offer letter and rental history and anticipated move in date, as this will speed up the process much quicker.  Any other questions, just let me know!
	 
	Thank You!
	Heather Hoffman
	Property Manager
	Residence at Milford Tower
	Beechmont Bluffs
	MGMT. OFFICE:(513)-831-6970
	FAX: (513)831-0357
	EMAIL: propmgr@residencatmilfordtower.com <mailto:propmgr@residencatmilfordtower.com>

                   WHEN nmf_det.ca_apcs_jpc_ck3_pct < 1.5 THEN 1
                   WHEN nmf_det.ca_apcs_jpc_ck3_pct BETWEEN 1.5 AND 3 THEN 2
                   WHEN nmf_det.ca_apcs_jpc_ck3_pct > 3 THEN 3
                   ELSE NULL
                END
             ELSE
                NULL
          END
             AS ca_needs_cat_id

Subject: Change and suggestions
Body:
I am taking this opportunity to thank everyone who contributed in launching my career into new levels. As I branch out into the world, I will remember each of you and how important you have become to my professional and personal growth. When I first started assisting at UC Berkeley, my new role felt a bit overwhelming at first. Quickly though, I was able to settle into my responsibilities with the guidance provided by each of you. Not only have you allowed me to grow in this position, but have made long lasting friends in each of you. I hope we will continue to keep in touch and see each each other again soon.
Regards,
Jing Hua Zhao
(P.S: you should thank each one individually not one email for everyone to see other thank you message. Some of the things you should not mention, it will hurt individual feeling, keep it simple and short, I will suggestion you email the paragraph I sent u to everyone, and you thank individual in person or greeting cards, that seems more professional)....thx

Subject: RE: Student Assistant Timesheets
Body:
Afternoon,

 

This is a reminder to submit your timesheets to me prior to close of business Monday September 22, 2014.  Please mail your original timesheets as well.  The original signed timesheets will be reviewed by me, scanned and mailed to Jamie Stedman for final approval.

 

Thank you Kyle Hassell and Mark Fleyshgauer for your prompt and professional timeliness in providing your timesheets.

 

Have A Great Weekend

 

Howard L. King

On Sep 19, 2014, at 11:05 AM, "Pyle, Thomas A@DOT" <tom.pyle@dot.ca.gov <mailto:tom.pyle@dot.ca.gov> > wrote:

	Dear Russell and Tom

	 

	The department has  ground penetrating radar data from a couple of years ago.   It is in processed, and could potentially be of use to your members.  It has been requested by an organization that would fall with Tom’s scope.   We have not been able to determine a simple way to transfer this data, via online means, due to restrictions in the departments firewalls.  

	 

	Tom, we will thus send you a disk of the requested data, which we have prepared from the University of California, Davis.

	 

	Russell, if you would like to let your members know this is available, I would be happy to forward a copy of this statewide data, by a CD.  Below is a sample and format of the data to show what it would look like.  Pay no attention to the color codings.

	 

	<image001.png>

	 

	<image004.jpg>

	 

	Please let me know if you have any questions.

	 

	Sincerely, 

	Tom Pyle

	Chief, Office of Pavement Management and Data Collection

	Sacramento, CA  95833

-Tom  

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT 
Sent: Friday, September 19, 2014 11:05 AM
To: 'info@calapa.net'; tom.tietz@cncement.org
Cc: Price, Steve N@DOT; Balasubramanian, Srikanth N@DOT; Massey, Susan C@DOT; Farnbach, William K@DOT; Burmas, Nick I@DOT
Subject: GPR Data

 

Dear Russell and Tom

 

The department has  ground penetrating radar data from a couple of years ago.   It is in processed, and could potentially be of use to your members.  It has been requested by an organization that would fall with Tom’s scope.   We have not been able to determine a simple way to transfer this data, via online means, due to restrictions in the departments firewalls.  

 

Tom, we will thus send you a disk of the requested data, which we have prepared from the University of California, Davis.

 

Russell, if you would like to let your members know this is available, I would be happy to forward a copy of this statewide data, by a CD.  Below is a sample and format of the data to show what it would look like.  Pay no attention to the color codings.

 



 



 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

Sincerely, 

Tom Pyle

Chief, Office of Pavement Management and Data Collection

Sacramento, CA  95833

Subject: Dulce:  FW: HPMS Feedback
Body:
Hi Dulce

 

The FHWA feedback letter states that we did not provide all of our IRI.  Did the Pavement Program provide a complete set of IRI DRISI?  I thought we did.  FHWA made the following note  “Of the 14,193.21 CL miles of NHS highways reported, IRI was populated on 12,432.2 CL miles of highway (87.59%), a 5% improvement over last year. IRI is required on all NHS highways, on certain Functional Systems and Samples.

 

Thanks

 

-Tom

Subject: FW: Collectin of the off system NHS
Body:
FYI

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT 
Sent: Friday, September 19, 2014 4:03 PM
To: Baker, Chad T@DOT
Cc: Alconcel, Brian W@DOT
Subject: RE: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Hi Chad

 

This is great!   Will this include data on the Class 3 roads?  

 

-Thanks,

 

Tom

 

From: Baker, Chad T@DOT 
Sent: Monday, September 15, 2014 12:06 PM
To: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Cc: Alconcel, Brian W@DOT
Subject: RE: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Hi Tom,

 

We are on track to deliver the on-system LRS by October 6th (original estimate was September 22nd) which includes updates for the 37 routes with identified changes between the Jan 30, 2012  and Jan 30, 2014 TSN data queries.

 

I’ll let Brian cover the off-system LRS item.

 

Thanks,

Chad Baker, Chief

Office of Data Services and Technology

Division of Research, Innovation and System Information

1120 N Street, MS 83 - Sacramento, CA - 95814

916-651-5720

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT 
Sent: Monday, September 15, 2014 11:33 AM
To: Baker, Chad T@DOT; Alconcel, Brian W@DOT
Subject: FW: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Gentlemen

 

Please see the green highlight below…

 

The Pavement Program will need for you to provide the LRS for the off-system collection, which can begin as soon as the contract s awarded.   

 

Also, I will need the LRS for the Caltrans On-system by Mid December.  

 

When will these be delivered?  

 

Thank You,

 

-Tom

274.6188

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT 
Sent: Wednesday, September 10, 2014 10:38 AM
To: Alconcel, Brian W@DOT; Baker, Chad T@DOT
Cc: Feldman, Dulce R@DOT; Samuelson, Mark S@DOT; Sah, Kamal K@DOT; Price, Steve N@DOT
Subject: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Brian, Chad

 

The Pavement Program currently has the APCS contract in advertisement.  I have attached the final bid document.  We start contract evaluation on September 22nd.  

 

I would like to bring you up to date on the schedule.   

 

We expect to award the contract by the middle of October.   It will be shortly after that when we will be able to begin the collection.   In the contract we have allocated for 7000 miles of off-system NHS collection, as is shown in the screen shot of the 1st paragraph below.   The On-system will begin on January 2nd for the entire on-system network, and must be completed with-in 8 months.   The off-system has 12 months for completion.

 



 

Please note there are two things we need from your division:  

1.       We will need the LRS of the off system, to provide to the contractor, for this collection to begin, which will be as early as late October.  

2.       By mid December we must have the updated Caltrans LRS for the contractor to begin that collection.  

 

 

Please let me know when you can provide this information and if you have any questions.

 

Sincerely, 

 

Tom Pyle

Chief, Office of Pavement Management and Performance

Pavement Program

Maintenance Division

2389 Gateway Oaks

Sacramento, California   95833

Sent: Monday, September 22, 2014 7:28 AM
To: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Cc: Jim Edgerton
Subject: RE: contract items

 

:) Sorry I was forwarding that to Jim and typed your name instead!

 

We are putting something together.  Can I get a copy of the code for the coarse segmentation?  I’ll need to see what it looks like.

 

I think Jim should have the hosting proposal for you today….

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT [mailto:tom.pyle@dot.ca.gov] 
Sent: Monday, September 22, 2014 10:26 AM
To: Eric Perrone
Subject: RE: contract items

 

I appreciate hearing from you.   Did you mean to actually, … I don’t know, write something?  :)  

 

From: Eric Perrone [mailto:eric@agileassets.com] 
Sent: Monday, September 22, 2014 6:51 AM
To: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Subject: FW: contract items

 

 

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT [mailto:tom.pyle@dot.ca.gov] 
Sent: Friday, September 19, 2014 7:09 PM
To: Eric Perrone
Subject: contract items

 

Hi Eric

 

Food for thought.  

 

I would like to add, that I had a meeting with some professors at USC this week and it may be that they are able to add to services for modeling, re-writing the engineering configuration, or preparing the users guide.   USC has some talent, and they  would VERY much like to assist Caltrans, and are willing to do so at reduced rates.   

 

Have a great weekend!

 

BTW… on Monday I am out pretty much for the week doing the APCS new contract evaluation and Zhongren is away to Shanghai having fun.

Sent: Friday, September 19, 2014 11:05 AM
To: Info; tom.tietz@cncement.org <mailto:tom.tietz@cncement.org> 
Cc: Price, Steve N@DOT; Balasubramanian, Srikanth N@DOT; Massey, Susan C@DOT; Farnbach, William K@DOT; Burmas, Nick I@DOT
Subject: GPR Data

 

Dear Russell and Tom

 

The department has  ground penetrating radar data from a couple of years ago.   It is in processed, and could potentially be of use to your members.  It has been requested by an organization that would fall with Tom’s scope.   We have not been able to determine a simple way to transfer this data, via online means, due to restrictions in the departments firewalls.  

 

Tom, we will thus send you a disk of the requested data, which we have prepared from the University of California, Davis.

 

Russell, if you would like to let your members know this is available, I would be happy to forward a copy of this statewide data, by a CD.  Below is a sample and format of the data to show what it would look like.  Pay no attention to the color codings.

 



 



 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

Sincerely, 

Tom Pyle

Chief, Office of Pavement Management and Data Collection

2389 Gateway Oaks Drive

Sacramento, CA  95833

916.274.6188

Subject: FW: Collectin of the off system NHS
Body:
FYI… 

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT 
Sent: Tuesday, September 23, 2014 8:42 AM
To: Gallagher, Leo P@DOT; Singh, Navneet@DOT; Meek, Fay S@DOT
Cc: Baker, Chad T@DOT; Navai, Reza@DOT
Subject: FW: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Hello Navneet, Leo and Fay

 

Chad Baker is soon to provide the Pavement Program with the new LRS.  We would like to attach to this data, the attributes and classifications of the Caltrans system.  

 

I am looking  for information on the functional classes of Caltrans’ state highways.   Also, I am looking for lifeline routes, farm to market routes, (not sure if that is an official term) and gateway routes.  There are some other routes such as Goods Movement and High Emphasis routes.   

 

Our office is developing the Pavement Management System, and this information is very helpful for us to be able to develop pavement rehabilitation priorities across the state.  

 

Do you have this information?

 

Thank you,

 

Tom Pyle

Chief, Office of Pavement Management

Maintenance Division

2389 Gateway Oaks

Sacramento CA 95833

916.274.6188

 

From: Baker, Chad T@DOT 
Sent: Monday, September 22, 2014 7:36 AM
To: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Cc: Alconcel, Brian W@DOT
Subject: RE: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Hi Tom,

 

The entirety of the state highway system (minus ramps/connectors) is included in the on-system LRS. This is independent of the functional class assignment for any segment of the SHS.

 

Thanks,

Chad Baker, Chief

Office of Data Services and Technology

Division of Research, Innovation and System Information

1120 N Street, MS 83 - Sacramento, CA - 95814

916-651-5720

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT 
Sent: Friday, September 19, 2014 4:03 PM
To: Baker, Chad T@DOT
Cc: Alconcel, Brian W@DOT
Subject: RE: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Hi Chad

 

This is great!   Will this include data on the Class 3 roads?  

 

-Thanks,

 

Tom

 

From: Baker, Chad T@DOT 
Sent: Monday, September 15, 2014 12:06 PM
To: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Cc: Alconcel, Brian W@DOT
Subject: RE: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Hi Tom,

 

We are on track to deliver the on-system LRS by October 6th (original estimate was September 22nd) which includes updates for the 37 routes with identified changes between the Jan 30, 2012  and Jan 30, 2014 TSN data queries.

 

I’ll let Brian cover the off-system LRS item.

 

Thanks,

Chad Baker, Chief

Office of Data Services and Technology

Division of Research, Innovation and System Information

1120 N Street, MS 83 - Sacramento, CA - 95814

916-651-5720

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT 
Sent: Monday, September 15, 2014 11:33 AM
To: Baker, Chad T@DOT; Alconcel, Brian W@DOT
Subject: FW: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Gentlemen

 

Please see the green highlight below…

 

The Pavement Program will need for you to provide the LRS for the off-system collection, which can begin as soon as the contract s awarded.   

 

Also, I will need the LRS for the Caltrans On-system by Mid December.  

 

When will these be delivered?  

 

Thank You,

 

-Tom

274.6188

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT 
Sent: Wednesday, September 10, 2014 10:38 AM
To: Alconcel, Brian W@DOT; Baker, Chad T@DOT
Cc: Feldman, Dulce R@DOT; Samuelson, Mark S@DOT; Sah, Kamal K@DOT; Price, Steve N@DOT
Subject: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Brian, Chad

 

The Pavement Program currently has the APCS contract in advertisement.  I have attached the final bid document.  We start contract evaluation on September 22nd.  

 

I would like to bring you up to date on the schedule.   

 

We expect to award the contract by the middle of October.   It will be shortly after that when we will be able to begin the collection.   In the contract we have allocated for 7000 miles of off-system NHS collection, as is shown in the screen shot of the 1st paragraph below.   The On-system will begin on January 2nd for the entire on-system network, and must be completed with-in 8 months.   The off-system has 12 months for completion.

 



 

Please note there are two things we need from your division:  

1.       We will need the LRS of the off system, to provide to the contractor, for this collection to begin, which will be as early as late October.  

2.       By mid December we must have the updated Caltrans LRS for the contractor to begin that collection.  

 

 

Please let me know when you can provide this information and if you have any questions.

 

Sincerely, 

 

Tom Pyle

Chief, Office of Pavement Management and Performance

Pavement Program

Maintenance Division

2389 Gateway Oaks

Sacramento, California   95833

916.274.6188

Subject: FW: California pavement question
Body:
Hello all

 

If you have information that Lisa is looking for, or can send her to the correct office, I am sure she would appreciate it.   

 

-Tom

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT 
Sent: Tuesday, September 23, 2014 9:03 AM
To: 'Lisa Kalakanis'
Subject: RE: California pavement question

 

Hello Lisa

 

Caltrans has about 15,000 miles of state maintained miles (I believe it is close to 14,600 CL of pavement and another 500 of bridge CL miles).  The number you have referenced is the lane miles.  

 

I do not have the data for the other items you have requested, but I will forward to some who may have that data.  

 

Sincerely,

Tom Pyle

Office of Pavement Management

916.274.6188

 

From: Lisa Kalakanis [mailto:Lisa.Kalakanis@tlc.state.tx.us] 
Sent: Tuesday, September 23, 2014 8:45 AM
To: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Subject: California pavement question

 

Hi Mr. Pyle,

 

I’m a member of the Research Division of the Texas Legislative Council in Austin, TX. We are working on a request for a member of the legislature, and I’m needing to determine the total number of state-maintained centerline miles in California. I’ve seen this report http://www.dot.ca.gov/hq/maint/Pavement/Pavement_Program/PDF/2013_SOP_FINAL-Dec_2013-1-24-13.pdf online but am trying to confirm that 49,720 is indeed the total state-maintained centerline miles only? Also, I’m wondering if you have this total broken down by interstate highways, US highways, state highways/spurs/loops/business routes, Farm or Ranch to market roads/spurs, Pass/park /rec roads, and frontage roads? If so, that would be extremely useful! We are on sort of a short deadline, so any help you can provide would be greatly appreciated.

 

Thanks,

 

Lisa

 

 

Lisa Kalakanis

Social Policy Statistician

Texas Legislative Council

512-463-1143

Subject: PETER:  FW: Collectin of the off system NHS
Body:
Peter

 

Can you please work with Navneet to get the files for the functional classes of the routes.   

 

Thank you

 

-Tom

 

From: Singh, Navneet@DOT 
Sent: Tuesday, September 23, 2014 10:01 AM
To: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT; Gallagher, Leo P@DOT; Meek, Fay S@DOT
Cc: Baker, Chad T@DOT; Navai, Reza@DOT; Cuellar, Rose L G@DOT; Alconcel, Brian W@DOT
Subject: RE: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Hi Tom,

 

We do have the information for Functional Classification and Nation Highway System. Functional Classification information is available in GIS format (shape file) for all routes and NHS information is available in Excel spread sheet for all routes and shape files for State Highways.

 

Navneet.

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT 
Sent: Tuesday, September 23, 2014 8:42 AM
To: Gallagher, Leo P@DOT; Singh, Navneet@DOT; Meek, Fay S@DOT
Cc: Baker, Chad T@DOT; Navai, Reza@DOT
Subject: FW: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Hello Navneet, Leo and Fay

 

Chad Baker is soon to provide the Pavement Program with the new LRS.  We would like to attach to this data, the attributes and classifications of the Caltrans system.  

 

I am looking  for information on the functional classes of Caltrans’ state highways.   Also, I am looking for lifeline routes, farm to market routes, (not sure if that is an official term) and gateway routes.  There are some other routes such as Goods Movement and High Emphasis routes.   

 

Our office is developing the Pavement Management System, and this information is very helpful for us to be able to develop pavement rehabilitation priorities across the state.  

 

Do you have this information?

 

Thank you,

 

Tom Pyle

Chief, Office of Pavement Management

Maintenance Division

2389 Gateway Oaks

Sacramento CA 95833

916.274.6188

The entirety of the state highway system (minus ramps/connectors) is included in the on-system LRS. This is independent of the functional class assignment for any segment of the SHS.

Gentlemen

 

Please see the green highlight below…

 

The Pavement Program will need for you to provide the LRS for the off-system collection, which can begin as soon as the contract s awarded.   

 

Also, I will need the LRS for the Caltrans On-system by Mid December.

274.6188

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT 
Sent: Wednesday, September 10, 2014 10:38 AM
To: Alconcel, Brian W@DOT; Baker, Chad T@DOT
Cc: Feldman, Dulce R@DOT; Samuelson, Mark S@DOT; Sah, Kamal K@DOT; Price, Steve N@DOT
Subject: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Brian, Chad

 

The Pavement Program currently has the APCS contract in advertisement.  I have attached the final bid document.  We start contract evaluation on September 22nd.  

 

I would like to bring you up to date on the schedule.   

 

We expect to award the contract by the middle of October.   It will be shortly after that when we will be able to begin the collection.   In the contract we have allocated for 7000 miles of off-system NHS collection, as is shown in the screen shot of the 1st paragraph below.   The On-system will begin on January 2nd for the entire on-system network, and must be completed with-in 8 months.   The off-system has 12 months for completion.

 



 

Please note there are two things we need from your division:  

1.       We will need the LRS of the off system, to provide to the contractor, for this collection to begin, which will be as early as late October.  

2.       By mid December we must have the updated Caltrans LRS for the contractor to begin that collection.  

 

 

Please let me know when you can provide this information and if you have any questions.

 

Sincerely, 

 

Tom Pyle

Chief, Office of Pavement Management and Performance

Pavement Program

Maintenance Division

2389 Gateway Oaks

Sacramento, California   95833

Subject: FW: Collectin of the off system NHS
Body:
Look what we got!  

 

Peter… This is what we need.   Can you please see what it will take to get these loaded into our NMF.  

 

Thank you

 

-Tom

 

From: Meek, Fay S@DOT 
Sent: Tuesday, September 23, 2014 12:29 PM
To: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT
Cc: Baker, Chad T@DOT; Singh, Navneet@DOT; De Terra, Bruce W@DOT
Subject: FW: Collectin of the off system NHS

 

Hi Tom,

 

Attached are files from our office (DOTP) that you requested or may want: IRRS Routes, HE Routes,  and Freight Network (includes FHWA Primary Freight Network 27k and 41K, additional Interstates and state highway and Focus Routes)   Note: we no longer use the Goods Movement Routes that was used in the past.

 

We no longer use lifeline routes.  Note from the Interregional Transportation Strategic Plan Status Update, page 17:  STRATEGIC HIGHWAY NETWORK (STRAHNET) as Lifeline Routes.  For purposes of consistency with federal policy, Caltrans will use the Strategic Highway Network (STRAHNET) for emergency response planning. The STRAHNET designation was created, and is administered, by the U.S. Department of Defense. It is a nationwide system of highways within the NHS that may be used to transport personnel and equipment in emergencies. It includes a sub-system of “connectors” on State highways and local roads for movement primarily into water ports and military installations. Rather than designate a separate emergency road system, Caltrans will utilize the STRAHNET.

You should be able to get the STRAHNET routes from Navneet’s group.  

 

If you have an old shapefile for Goods Movement Routes, that’s no longer valid.  See attached map and California Freight Mobility Plan (Draft) Document, (Chapter 2-1: Freight System Assets) for explanation on California’s Freight Network. http://www.dot.ca.gov/hq/tpp/offices/ogm/cfmp.html

 

We do not have farm to market routes or gateway routes.  However, when FHWA finalizes the National Freight Network it will include critical rural freight corridors which may meet your needs.  See: US Code: http://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/pkg/USCODE-2012-title23/pdf/USCODE-2012-title23-chap1-sec167.pdf and NFN: http://www.ops.fhwa.dot.gov/freight/infrastructure/nfn/

 

Thank you,

Fay Meek

 

 

From: Pyle, Thomas A@DOT 
Sent: Tuesday, September 23, 2014 8:42 AM
To: Gallagher, Leo P@DOT; Singh, Navneet@DOT; Meek, Fay S@DOT
Cc: Baker, Chad T@DOT; Navai, Reza@DOT

I am looking  for information on the functional classes of Caltrans’ state highways.   Also, I am looking for lifeline routes, farm to market routes, (not sure if that is an official term) and gateway routes.  There are some other routes such as Goods Movement and High Emphasis routes.   

 

Our office is developing the Pavement Management System, and this information is very helpful for us to be able to develop pavement rehabilitation priorities across the state.
